table.name: account
table.summary: Used in the accounting section in chart of accounts. Not related to patient accounts in any way.

column.name: AccountNum
column.summary: Primary key..

column.name: AcctType
column.summary: Enum:AccountType Asset, Liability, Equity,Revenue, Expense

Enumeration.name: AccountType
Enumeration.summary: Used in accounting for chart of accounts.

column.name: BankNumber
column.summary: For asset accounts, this would be the bank account number for deposit slips.

column.name: Inactive
column.summary: Set to true to not normally view this account in the list.

table.name: accountingautopay
table.summary: In the accounting section, this automates entries into the database when user enters a payment into a patient account. This table presents the user with a picklist specific to that payment type. For example, a cash payment would create a picklist of cashboxes for user to put the cash into.

column.name: AccountingAutoPayNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: PayType
column.summary: FK to definition.DefNum.

column.name: PickList
column.summary: FK to account.AccountNum. AccountNums separated by commas. No spaces.

table.name: adjustment
table.summary: An adjustment in the patient account. Usually, adjustments are very simple, just being assigned to one patient and provider. But they can also be attached to a procedure to represent a discount on that procedure. Attaching adjustments to procedures is not automated, so it is not very common.

column.name: AdjNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: AdjDate
column.summary: The date that the adjustment shows in the patient account.

column.name: AdjAmt
column.summary: Amount of adjustment. Can be pos or neg.

column.name: PatNum
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

column.name: AdjType
column.summary: FK to definition.DefNum.

column.name: ProvNum
column.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

column.name: AdjNote
column.summary: Note for this adjustment.

column.name: ProcDate
column.summary: Procedure date. Not when the adjustment was entered. This is what the aging will be based on in a future version.

column.name: ProcNum
column.summary: FK to procedurelog.ProcNum. Only used if attached to a procedure. Otherwise, 0.

column.name: DateEntry
column.summary: Timestamp automatically generated and user not allowed to change. The actual date of entry.

column.name: ClinicNum
column.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.

table.name: appointment
table.summary: Appointments can show in the Appointments module, or they can be on the unscheduled list. An appointment object is also used to store the Planned appointment. The planned appointment never gets scheduled, but instead gets copied.

column.name: AptNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: PatNum
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. The patient that the appointment is for.

column.name: AptStatus
column.summary: Enum:ApptStatus .

Enumeration.name: ApptStatus
Enumeration.summary: Appointment status.
Enumeration.EnumValue: 0- No appointment should ever have this status.
1- Shows as a regularly scheduled appointment.
4- Functions almost the same as Scheduled, but also causes the appointment to show on the ASAP list.
5- Shows with a big X on it.
6- Planned appointment. Only shows in Chart module. User not allowed to change this status, and it does not display as one of the options.
7- Patient "post-it" note on the schedule. Shows light yellow. Shows on day scheduled just like appt, as well as in prog notes, etc.

column.name: Pattern
column.summary: Time pattern, X for Dr time, / for assist time. Stored in 5 minute increments. Converted as needed to 10 or 15 minute representations for display.

column.name: Confirmed
column.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. This field can also be used to show patient arrived, in chair, etc. The Category column in the definition table is DefCat.ApptConfirmed.

column.name: TimeLocked
column.summary: If true, then the program will not attempt to reset the user's time pattern and length when adding or removing procedures.

column.name: Op
column.summary: FK to operatory.OperatoryNum.

column.name: Note
column.summary: Note.

column.name: ProvNum
column.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

column.name: ProvHyg
column.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum. Optional. Only used if a hygienist is assigned to this appt.

column.name: AptDateTime
column.summary: Appointment Date and time. If you need just the date or time for an SQL query, you can use DATE(AptDateTime) and TIME(AptDateTime) in your query.

column.name: NextAptNum
column.summary: FK to appointment.AptNum. A better description of this field would be PlannedAptNum. Only used to show that this apt is derived from specified planned apt. Otherwise, 0.

column.name: UnschedStatus
column.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. The definition.Category in the definition table is DefCat.RecallUnschedStatus. Only used if this is an Unsched or Planned appt.

column.name: IsNewPatient
column.summary: This is the first appoinment this patient has had at this office. Somewhat automated.

column.name: ProcDescript
column.summary: A one line summary of all procedures. Can be used in various reports, Unscheduled list, and Planned appointment tracker. Not user editable right now, so it doesn't show on the screen.

column.name: Assistant
column.summary: FK to employee.EmployeeNum. You can assign an assistant to the appointment.

column.name: ClinicNum
column.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. 0 if no clinic.

column.name: IsHygiene
column.summary: Set true if this is a hygiene appt. The hygiene provider's color will show.

column.name: DateTStamp
column.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed.

column.name: DateTimeArrived
column.summary: The date and time that the patient checked in. Date is largely ignored since it should be the same as the appt.

column.name: DateTimeSeated
column.summary: The date and time that the patient was seated in the chair in the operatory.

column.name: DateTimeDismissed
column.summary: The date and time that the patient got up out of the chair

column.name: InsPlan1
column.summary: FK to insplan.PlanNum for the primary insurance plan at the time the appointment is set complete. May be 0. We can't tell later which subscriber is involved; only the plan.

column.name: InsPlan2
column.summary: FK to insplan.PlanNum for the secoondary insurance plan at the time the appointment is set complete. May be 0. We can't tell later which subscriber is involved; only the plan.

column.name: DateTimeAskedToArrive
column.summary: Date and time patient asked to arrive, or minval if patient not asked to arrive at a different time than appt.

column.name: ProcsColored
column.summary: Stores XML for the procs colors

table.name: appointmentrule
table.summary: For now, the rule is simple. It simply blocks all double booking of the specified code range. The double booking would have to be for the same provider. This can later be extended to provide more complex rules, such as partial double booking, time limitations, etc.

column.name: AppointmentRuleNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: RuleDesc
column.summary: The description of the rule which will be displayed to the user.

column.name: CodeStart
column.summary: The procedure code of the start of the range.

column.name: CodeEnd
column.summary: The procedure code of the end of the range.

column.name: IsEnabled
column.summary: Usually true. But this does allow you to turn off a rule temporarily without losing the settings.

table.name: apptfield
table.summary: These are custom fields added to appointments and managed by the user.

column.name: ApptFieldNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: AptNum
column.summary: FK to appointment.AptNum

column.name: FieldName
column.summary: FK to apptfielddef.FieldName. The full name is shown here for ease of use when running queries. But the user is only allowed to change fieldNames in the patFieldDef setup window.

column.name: FieldValue
column.summary: Any text that the user types in. Will later allow some automation.

table.name: apptfielddef
table.summary: These are the definitions for the custom patient fields added and managed by the user.

column.name: ApptFieldDefNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: FieldName
column.summary: The name of the field that the user will be allowed to fill in the appt edit window. Duplicates are prevented.

table.name: apptview
table.summary: Enables viewing a variety of operatories or providers. This table holds the views that the user picks between. The apptviewitem table holds the items attached to each view.

column.name: ApptViewNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: Description
column.summary: Description of this view. Gets displayed in Appt module.

column.name: ItemOrder
column.summary: 0-based order to display in lists. Every view must have a unique itemorder, but it is acceptable to have some missing itemorders in the sequence.

column.name: RowsPerIncr
column.summary: Number of rows per time increment. Usually 1 or 2. Programming note: Value updated to ContrApptSheet.RowsPerIncr to track current state.

column.name: OnlyScheduledProvs
column.summary: If set to true, then the only operatories that will show will be for providers that have schedules for the day, ops with no provs assigned.

column.name: OnlySchedBeforeTime
column.summary: If OnlyScheduledProvs is set to true, and this time is not 0:00, then only provider schedules with start or stop time before this time will be included.

column.name: OnlySchedAfterTime
column.summary: If OnlyScheduledProvs is set to true, and this time is not 0:00, then only provider schedules with start or stop time after this time will be included.

column.name: StackBehavUR
column.summary: Enum:ApptViewStackBehavior

column.name: StackBehavLR
column.summary: Enum:ApptViewStackBehavior

table.name: apptviewitem
table.summary: Each item is attached to a row in the apptview table. Each item specifies ONE of: OpNum, ProvNum, ElementDesc, or ApptFieldDefNum. The other three will be 0 or "".

column.name: ApptViewItemNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: ApptViewNum
column.summary: FK to apptview.

column.name: OpNum
column.summary: FK to operatory.OperatoryNum.

column.name: ProvNum
column.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

column.name: ElementDesc
column.summary: Must be one of the hard coded strings picked from the available list.

column.name: ElementOrder
column.summary: If this is a row Element, then this is the 0-based order within its area. For example, UR starts over with 0 ordering.

column.name: ElementColor
column.summary: If this is an element, then this is the color.

column.name: ElementAlignment
column.summary: Enum:ApptViewAlignment. If this is an element, then this is the alignment of the element within the appointment.

column.name: ApptFieldDefNum
column.summary: FK to apptfielddef.ApptFieldDefNum. If this is an element, and the element is an appt field, then this tells us which one.

column.name: PatFieldDefNum
column.summary: FK to patfielddef.PatFieldDefNum. If this is an element, and the element is an appt field, then this tells us which one. Not implemented yet.

table.name: autocode
table.summary: An autocode automates entering procedures. The user only has to pick composite, for instance, and the autocode figures out the code based on the number of surfaces, and posterior vs. anterior. Autocodes also enforce and suggest changes to a procedure code if the number of surfaces or other properties change.

column.name: AutoCodeNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: Description
column.summary: Displays meaningful decription, like "Amalgam".

column.name: IsHidden
column.summary: User can hide autocodes

column.name: LessIntrusive
column.summary: This will be true if user no longer wants to see this autocode message when closing a procedure. This makes it less intrusive, but it can still be used in procedure buttons.

table.name: autocodecond
table.summary: AutoCode condition. Always attached to an AutoCodeItem, which is then, in turn, attached to an autocode. There is usually only one or two conditions for a given AutoCodeItem.

column.name: AutoCodeCondNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: AutoCodeItemNum
column.summary: FK to autocodeitem.AutoCodeItemNum.

column.name: Cond
column.summary: Enum:AutoCondition

table.name: autocodeitem
table.summary: Corresponds to the autocodeitem table in the database. There are multiple AutoCodeItems for a given AutoCode. Each Item has one ADA code.

column.name: AutoCodeItemNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: AutoCodeNum
column.summary: FK to autocode.AutoCodeNum

column.name: OldCode
column.summary: Do not use

column.name: CodeNum
column.summary: FK to procedurecode.CodeNum

table.name: automation
table.summary: A trigger event causes one or more actions.

column.name: AutomationNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: Autotrigger
column.summary: Enum:AutomationTrigger What triggers this automation

column.name: ProcCodes
column.summary: If this has a CompleteProcedure trigger, this is a comma-delimited list of codes that will trigger the action.

column.name: AutoAction
column.summary: The action taken as a result of the trigger. To get more than one action, create multiple automation entries.

column.name: SheetDefNum
column.summary: FK to sheetdef.SheetDefNum. If the action is to print a sheet, then this tells which sheet to print. So it must be a custom sheet. Also, not that this organization does not allow passing parameters to the sheet such as which procedures were completed, or which appt was broken.

column.name: CommType
column.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. Only used if action is CreateCommlog.

column.name: MessageContent
column.summary: If a commlog action, then this is the text that goes in the commlog. If this is a ShowStatementNoteBold action, then this is the NoteBold. Might later be expanded to work with email or to use variables.

column.name: AutoNoteNum
column.summary: Primary key

column.name: AutoNoteName
column.summary: Name of AutoNote

column.name: MainText
column.summary: Was 'ControlsToInc' in previous versions.

table.name: autonotecontrol
table.summary: In the program, this is now called an autonote prompt.

column.name: AutoNoteControlNum
column.summary: Primary key

column.name: Descript
column.summary: The description of the prompt as it will be referred to from other windows.

column.name: ControlType
column.summary: 'Text', 'OneResponse', or 'MultiResponse'. More types to be added later.

column.name: ControlLabel
column.summary: The prompt text.

column.name: ControlOptions
column.summary: For TextBox, this is the default text. For a ComboBox, this is the list of possible responses, one per line.

table.name: benefit
table.summary: Corresponds to the benefit table in the database which replaces the old covpat table. A benefit is usually a percentage, deductible, limitation, max, or similar. Each row represents a single benefit. A benefit can have a value in EITHER PlanNum OR PatPlanNum. If it is for a PlanNum, the most common, then the benefit is attached to an insurance plan. If it is for a PatPlanNum, then it overrides the plan benefit, usually a percentage, for a single patient. Benefits we can't handle yet include posterior composites, COB duplication, amounts used, in/out of plan network, authorization required, missing tooth exclusion, and any date related limitations like waiting periods. Here are examples of typical usage which parallel X12 usage. Example fields shown in this order: CovCat, ProcCode(- indicates blank), BenefitType, Percent, MonetaryAmt, TimePeriod, QuantityQualifier, Quantity, CoverageLevel Annual Max Indiv $1000: None/General,-,Limitations,-1,1000,CalendarYear,None,0,Individual Restorative 80%: Restorative,-,CoInsurance,80,-1,CalendarYear,None,0,None $50 deductible: None/General,-,Deductible,-1,50,CalendarYear,None,0,Individual Deductible waived on preventive: Preventive,-,Deductible,-1,0,CalendarYear,None,0,Individual 1 pano every 5 years: None,D0330,Limitations,-1,-1,Years?,Years,5,None 2 exams per year: Preventive(or Diagnostic),-,Limitations,-1,-1,BenefitYear,NumberOfServices,2,None Fluoride limit 18yo: None, D1204, Limitations, -1, -1, CalendarYear/None, AgeLimit, 18,None (might require a second identical entry for D1205) 4BW every 6 months: None, D0274, Limitations, -1, -1, None, Months, 6,None. The text above might be difficult to read. We are trying to improve the white spacing.

column.name: BenefitNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: PlanNum
column.summary: FK to insplan.PlanNum. Most benefits should be attached using PlanNum. The exception would be if each patient has a different percentage. If PlanNum is used, then PatPlanNum should be 0.

column.name: PatPlanNum
column.summary: FK to patplan.PatPlanNum. It is rare to attach benefits this way. Usually only used to override percentages for patients. In this case, PlanNum should be 0.

column.name: CovCatNum
column.summary: FK to covcat.CovCatNum. Corresponds to X12 EB03- Service Type code. Situational, so it can be 0. Will probably be 0 for general deductible and annual max. There are very specific categories covered by X12. Users should set their InsCovCats to the defaults we provide.

column.name: BenefitType
column.summary: Enum:InsBenefitType Corresponds to X12 EB01. Examples: 0=ActiveCoverage, 1=CoInsurance, 2=Deductible, 3=CoPayment, 4=Exclusions, 5=Limitations. ActiveCoverage doesn't really provide meaningful information.

Enumeration.name: InsBenefitType
Enumeration.summary: Used in the benefit table. Corresponds to X12 EB01.
Enumeration.EnumValue: 0- Not usually used. Would only be used if you are just indicating that the patient is covered, but without any specifics.

1- Used for percentages to indicate portion that insurance will cover. When interpreting electronic benefit information, this is the opposite percentage, the percentage that the patient will pay after deductible.
2- The deductible amount. Might be two entries if, for instance, deductible is waived on preventive.
4- Services that are simply not covered at all.
5- Covers a variety of limitations, including Max, frequency, fee reductions, etc.

column.name: Percent
column.summary: Only used if BenefitType=CoInsurance. Valid values are 0 to 100. -1 indicates empty, which is almost always true if not CoInsurance. The percentage that insurance will pay on the procedure. Note that benefits coming from carriers are usually backwards, indicating the percetage that the patient is responsible for.

column.name: MonetaryAmt
column.summary: Used for CoPayment, Limitations, and Deductible. -1 indicates empty

column.name: TimePeriod
column.summary: Enum:BenefitTimePeriod Corresponds to X12 EB06, Time Period Qualifier. Examples: 0=None,1=ServiceYear,2=CalendarYear,3=Lifetime,4=Years. Might add Visit and Remaining.

Enumeration.name: BenefitTimePeriod
Enumeration.summary: Used in the benefit table. Corresponds to X12 EB06.
Enumeration.EnumValue: 0- A timeperiod is frequenly not needed. For example, percentages.
1- The renewal month is not Jan. In this case, we need to know the effective date so that we know which month the benefits start over in.
4- Wouldn't be used alone. Years would again be specified in the quantity field along with a number.

column.name: QuantityQualifier
column.summary: Enum:BenefitQuantity Corresponds to X12 EB09. Not used very much. Examples: 0=None,1=NumberOfServices,2=AgeLimit,3=Visits,4=Years,5=Months

Enumeration.name: BenefitQuantity
Enumeration.summary: Used in the benefit table in conjunction with an integer quantity.
Enumeration.EnumValue: 0- This is used a lot. Most benefits do not need any sort of quantity.
1- For example, two exams per year
2- For example, 18 when flouride only covered to 18 y.o.

column.name: Quantity
column.summary: Corresponds to X12 EB10. Qualify the quantity using QuantityQualifier.

column.name: CodeNum
column.summary: FK to procedurecode.CodeNum. Typical uses include fluoride, sealants, etc. If a specific code is used here, then the CovCat should be None.

column.name: CanadianNetworkNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: Abbrev
column.summary: This will also be the folder name

table.name: carrier
table.summary: Every InsPlan has a Carrier. The carrier stores the name and address.

column.name: CarrierNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: CarrierName
column.summary: Name of the carrier.

column.name: Address2
column.summary: Second line of address.

column.name: State
column.summary: 2 char in the US.

column.name: Zip
column.summary: Postal code.

column.name: Phone
column.summary: Includes any punctuation.

column.name: ElectID
column.summary: E-claims electronic payer id. 5 char in USA. 6 digits in Canada. I've seen an ID this long before: "LA-DHH-MEDICAID". The user interface currently limits length to 20, although db limits length to 255. X12 requires length between 2 and 80.

column.name: NoSendElect
column.summary: Do not send electronically. It's just a default; you can still send electronically.

column.name: IsCDA
column.summary: Canada: True if a CDAnet carrier. This has significant implications: 1. It can be filtered for in the list of carriers. 2. An ElectID is required. 3. The ElectID can never be used by another carrier. 4. If the carrier is attached to any etrans, then the ElectID cannot be changed (and, of course, the carrier cannot be deleted or combined).

column.name: CDAnetVersion
column.summary: The version of CDAnet supported. Either 02 or 04.

column.name: CanadianNetworkNum
column.summary: FK to canadiannetwork.CanadianNetworkNum. Only used in Canada.

column.name: CanadianEncryptionMethod
column.summary: 1=No Encryption, 2=CDAnet standard #1, 3=CDAnet standard #2. Field A10.

column.name: CanadianTransactionPrefix
column.summary: A01. Up to 12 char.

column.name: CanadianSupportedTypes
column.summary: Bit flags.

table.name: chartview
table.summary: Enables viewing a variety of views in chart module.

column.name: ChartViewNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: Description
column.summary: Description of this view. Gets displayed at top of Progress Notes grid.

column.name: ItemOrder
column.summary: 0-based order to display in lists.

column.name: ProcStatuses
column.summary: Enum:ChartViewProcStat None=0,TP=1,Complete=2,Existing Cur Prov=4,Existing Other Prov=8,Referred=16,Deleted=32,Condition=64,All=127.

column.name: ObjectTypes
column.summary: Enum:ChartViewObjs None=0,Appointments=1,Comm Log=2,Comm Log Family=4,Tasks=8,Email=16,LabCases=32,Rx=64,Sheets=128,All=255.

column.name: ShowProcNotes
column.summary: Set true to show procedure notes.

column.name: IsAudit
column.summary: Set true to enable audit mode.

column.name: SelectedTeethOnly
column.summary: Set true to only show information regarding the selected teeth.

column.name: OrionStatusFlags
column.summary: Which orion statuses to show. Will be zero if not orion.

table.name: claim
table.summary: The claim table holds information about individual claims. Each row represents one claim.

column.name: ClaimNum
column.summary: Primary key

column.name: PatNum
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum

column.name: DateService
column.summary: Usually the same date as the procedures, but it can be changed if you wish.

column.name: DateSent
column.summary: Usually the date it was created. It might be sent a few days later if you don't send your e-claims every day.

column.name: ClaimStatus
column.summary: Single char: U,H,W,P,S,or R. U=Unsent, H=Hold until pri received, W=Waiting in queue, S=Sent, R=Received. A(adj) is no longer used. P(prob sent) is no longer used.

column.name: DateReceived
column.summary: Date the claim was received.

column.name: PlanNum
column.summary: FK to insplan.PlanNum. Every claim is attached to one plan.

column.name: ProvTreat
column.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum. Treating provider.

column.name: ClaimFee
column.summary: Total fee of claim.

column.name: InsPayEst
column.summary: Amount insurance is estimated to pay on this claim.

column.name: InsPayAmt
column.summary: Amount insurance actually paid.

column.name: DedApplied
column.summary: Deductible applied to this claim.

column.name: PreAuthString
column.summary: The preauth number received from ins.

column.name: IsProsthesis
column.summary: Single char for No, Initial, or Replacement.

column.name: PriorDate
column.summary: Date prior prosthesis was placed. Note that this is only for paper claims. E-claims have a date field on each individual procedure.

column.name: ReasonUnderPaid
column.summary: Note for patient for why insurance didn't pay as expected.

column.name: ClaimNote
column.summary: Note to be sent to insurance. Max 255 char. E-claims also have notes on each procedure.

column.name: ClaimType
column.summary: "P"=primary, "S"=secondary, "PreAuth"=preauth, "Other"=other, "Cap"=capitation. Not allowed to be blank. Might need to add "Med"=medical claim.

column.name: ProvBill
column.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum. Billing provider. Assignment can be automated from the setup section.

column.name: ReferringProv
column.summary: FK to referral.ReferralNum.

column.name: RefNumString
column.summary: Referral number for this claim.

column.name: PlaceService
column.summary: Enum:PlaceOfService .

Enumeration.name: PlaceOfService
Enumeration.EnumValue: 5. CPT code 33. In X12, a similar code AdultLivCareFac 35 is mentioned.
6. CPT code ?. We use 11 for office.

column.name: AccidentRelated
column.summary: blank or A=Auto, E=Employment, O=Other.

column.name: AccidentDate
column.summary: Date of accident, if applicable.

column.name: AccidentST
column.summary: Accident state.

column.name: EmployRelated
column.summary: Enum:YN .

Enumeration.name: YN
Enumeration.summary: Unknown,Yes, or No.

column.name: IsOrtho
column.summary: True if is ortho.

column.name: OrthoRemainM
column.summary: Remaining months of ortho. Valid values are 1-36.

column.name: OrthoDate
column.summary: Date ortho appliance placed.

column.name: PatRelat
column.summary: Enum:Relat Relationship to subscriber. The relationship is copied from InsPlan when the claim is created. It might need to be changed in both places.

Enumeration.name: Relat
Enumeration.summary: Relationship to subscriber for insurance.

column.name: PlanNum2
column.summary: FK to insplan.PlanNum. Other coverage plan number. 0 if none. This provides the user with total control over what other coverage shows. This obviously limits the coverage on a single claim to two insurance companies.

column.name: PatRelat2
column.summary: Enum:Relat The relationship to the subscriber for other coverage on this claim.

Enumeration.name: Relat
Enumeration.summary: Relationship to subscriber for insurance.

column.name: WriteOff
column.summary: Sum of ClaimProc.Writeoff for this claim.

column.name: Radiographs
column.summary: The number of x-rays enclosed.

column.name: ClinicNum
column.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. 0 if no clinic. Since one claim cannot have procs from multiple clinics, the clinicNum is set when creating the claim and then cannot be changed. The claim would have to be deleted and recreated. Otherwise, if changing at the claim level, a feature would have to be added that synched all procs, claimprocs, and probably some other tables.

column.name: ClaimForm
column.summary: FK to claimform.ClaimFormNum. 0 if not assigned to use the claimform for the insplan.

column.name: EFormat
column.summary: Enum:EtransType to define a specific version of an e-claim. Only used for medical claims right now.

Enumeration.name: EtransType
Enumeration.summary: The _CA of some types should get stripped off when displaying to users.
Enumeration.EnumValue: 23 Text report from clearinghouse in human readable format.
When a Canadian message is sent, and an error comes back instead of a message. This store information about the error. The etrans with this type is attached it to the original etrans as an ack.

column.name: AttachedImages
column.summary: The number of intraoral images attached. Not the number of files attached. This is the value that goes on the 2006 claimform.

column.name: AttachedModels
column.summary: The number of models attached.

column.name: AttachedFlags
column.summary: A comma-delimited set of flag keywords. Can have one or more of the following: EoB,Note,Perio,Misc. Must also contain one of these: Mail or Elect.

column.name: AttachmentID
column.summary: Example: NEA#1234567. If present, and if the claim note does not already start with this Id, then it will be prepended to the claim note for both e-claims and mail. If using e-claims, this same ID will be used for all PWK segements.

column.name: CanadianMaterialsForwarded
column.summary: A08. Any combination of E(email), C(correspondence), M(models), X(x-rays), and I(images). So up to 5 char. Gets converted to a single char A-Z for e-claims.

column.name: CanadianReferralProviderNum
column.summary: B05. Optional. The 9-digit CDA number of the referring provider, or identifier of referring party up to 10 characters in length.

column.name: CanadianReferralReason
column.summary: B06. A number 0(none) through 13.

column.name: CanadianIsInitialLower
column.summary: F18. Y, N, or X(not a lower denture, crown, or bridge).

column.name: CanadianDateInitialLower
column.summary: F19. Mandatory if F18 is N.

column.name: CanadianMandProsthMaterial
column.summary: F21. If crown, not required. If denture or bridge, required if F18 is N. Single digit number code, 0-6. We added type 7, which is crown.

column.name: CanadianIsInitialUpper
column.summary: F15. Y, N, or X(not an upper denture, crown, or bridge).

column.name: CanadianDateInitialUpper
column.summary: F04. Mandatory if F15 is N.

column.name: CanadianMaxProsthMaterial
column.summary: F20. If crown, not required. If denture or bridge, required if F15 is N. 0 indicates empty response. Single digit number code, 1-6. We added type 7, which is crown.

column.name: InsSubNum
column.summary: FK to inssub.InsSubNum.

column.name: InsSubNum2
column.summary: FK to inssub.InsSubNum.

table.name: claimattach
table.summary: Keeps track of one image file attached to a claim. Multiple files can be attached to a claim using this method.

column.name: ClaimAttachNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: ClaimNum
column.summary: FK to claim.ClaimNum

column.name: DisplayedFileName
column.summary: The name of the file that shows on the claim. For example: tooth2.jpg.

column.name: ActualFileName
column.summary: The actual file is stored in the A-Z folder in EmailAttachments. (yes, even though it's not actually an email attachment) The files are named automatically based on Date/time along with a random number. This ensures that they will be sequential as well as unique.

table.name: claimform
table.summary: Stores the information for printing different types of claim forms. Each claimform has many claimformitems attached to it, one for each field on the claimform. This table has nothing to do with the actual claims. It just describes how to print them.

column.name: ClaimFormNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: Description
column.summary: eg. ADA2002 or CA Medicaid

column.name: IsHidden
column.summary: If true, then it will not be displayed in various claim form lists as a choice.

column.name: FontName
column.summary: Valid font name for all text on the form.

column.name: FontSize
column.summary: Font size for all text on the form.

column.name: UniqueID
column.summary: For instance OD12 or JoeDeveloper9. If you are a developer releasing claimforms, then this should be your name or company followed by a unique number. This will later make it easier for you to maintain your claimforms for your customers. All claimforms that we release will be of the form OD##. Forms that the user creates will have this field blank, protecting them from being changed by us. So far, we have built the following claimforms: ADA2002=OD1, Denti-Cal=OD2, ADA2000=OD3, HCFA1500=OD4, HCFA1500preprinted=OD5, Canadian=OD6, Belgian=OD7, ADA2006=OD8, 1500=OD9

column.name: PrintImages
column.summary: Set to false to not print images. This removes the background for printing on premade forms.

column.name: OffsetX
column.summary: Shifts all items by x/100th's of an inch to compensate for printer, typically less than 1/4 inch.

column.name: OffsetY
column.summary: Shifts all items by y/100th's of an inch to compensate for printer, typically less than 1/4 inch.

table.name: claimformitem
table.summary: One item is needed for each field on a claimform.

column.name: ClaimFormItemNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: ClaimFormNum
column.summary: FK to claimform.ClaimFormNum

column.name: ImageFileName
column.summary: If this item is an image. Usually only one per claimform. eg ADA2002.emf. Otherwise it MUST be left blank, or it will trigger an error that the image cannot be found.

column.name: FieldName
column.summary: Must be one of the hardcoded available fieldnames for claims.

column.name: FormatString
column.summary: For dates, the format string. ie MM/dd/yyyy or M d y among many other possibilities.

column.name: XPos
column.summary: The x position of the item on the claim form. In pixels. 100 pixels per inch.

column.name: YPos
column.summary: The y position of the item.

column.name: Width
column.summary: Limits the printable area of the item. Set to zero to not limit.

column.name: Height
column.summary: Limits the printable area of the item. Set to zero to not limit.

table.name: claimpayment
table.summary: Each row represents a single check from the insurance company. The amount may be split between patients using claimprocs. The amount of the check must always exactly equal the sum of all the claimprocs attached to it. There might be only one claimproc.

column.name: ClaimPaymentNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: CheckDate
column.summary: Date the check was entered into this system, not the date on the check.

column.name: CheckAmt
column.summary: The amount of the check.

column.name: CheckNum
column.summary: The check number.

column.name: BankBranch
column.summary: Bank and branch.

column.name: Note
column.summary: Note for this check if needed.

column.name: ClinicNum
column.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. 0 if no clinic.

column.name: DepositNum
column.summary: FK to deposit.DepositNum. 0 if not attached to any deposits.

column.name: CarrierName
column.summary: Descriptive name of the carrier just for reporting purposes.

table.name: claimproc
table.summary: Links procedures to claims. Also links ins payments to procedures or claims. Also used for estimating procedures even if no claim yet. Warning: One proc might be linked twice to a given claim if insurance made two payments. Many of the important fields are actually optional. For instance, ProcNum is only required if itemizing ins payment, and ClaimNum is blank if Status=adjustment,cap,or estimate.

column.name: ClaimProcNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: ProcNum
column.summary: FK to procedurelog.ProcNum.

column.name: ClaimNum
column.summary: FK to claim.ClaimNum.

column.name: PatNum
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

column.name: ProvNum
column.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum. At least one office has been manually setting their claimproc provider to a different provider when entering payments as a means to track provider income. So we can't force this to always be the same as the procedure. We also don't want to change any historical data, so only synched when setting appt complete or if an estimate.

column.name: FeeBilled
column.summary: Fee billed to insurance. Might not be the same as the actual fee. The fee billed can be different than the actual procedure. For instance, if you have set the insurance plan to bill insurance using UCR fees, then this field will contain the UCR fee instead of the fee that the patient was charged.

column.name: InsPayEst
column.summary: Only if attached to a claim. Actual amount this carrier is expected to pay, after taking everything else into account. Considers annual max, override, percentAmt, copayAmt, deductible, etc. This estimate is computed automatically when sent to ins.

column.name: DedApplied
column.summary: 0 if blank. Deductible applied to this procedure only. Only for procedures attached to claims. Otherwise, the DedEst and DedEstOverride are used.

column.name: Status
column.summary: Enum:ClaimProcStatus .

Enumeration.name: ClaimProcStatus
Enumeration.summary: Claimproc Status. The status must generally be the same as the claim, although it is sometimes not strictly enforced.
Enumeration.EnumValue: 0: For claims that have been created or sent, but have not been received.
1: For claims that have been received.
3: The only place that this status is used is to make adjustments to benefits from the coverage window. It is never attached to a claim.
4:This differs from Received only slightly. It's for additional payments on procedures already received. Most fields are blank.

5: CapClaim is used when you want to send a claim to a capitation insurance company. These are similar to Supplemental in that there will always be a duplicate claimproc for a procedure. The first claimproc tracks the copay and writeoff, has a status of CapComplete, and is never attached to a claim. The second claimproc has status of CapClaim.

6: Estimates have replaced the fields that were in the procedure table. Once a procedure is complete, the claimprocstatus will still be Estimate. An Estimate can be attached to a claim and status gets changed to NotReceived.

7: For capitation procedures that are complete. This replaces the old procedurelog.CapCoPay field. This stores the copay and writeoff amounts. The copay is only there for reference, while it is the writeoff that actually affects the balance. Never attached to a claim. If procedure is TP, then status will be CapEstimate. Only set to CapComplete if procedure is Complete.
8: For capitation procedures that are still estimates rather than complete. When procedure is completed, this can be changed to CapComplete, but never to anything else.

column.name: InsPayAmt
column.summary: Amount insurance actually paid.

column.name: Remarks
column.summary: The remarks that insurance sends in the EOB about procedures.

column.name: ClaimPaymentNum
column.summary: FK to claimpayment.ClaimPaymentNum(the insurance check).

column.name: PlanNum
column.summary: FK to insplan.PlanNum

column.name: DateCP
column.summary: This is the date that is used for payment reports and tracks the payment date. Always exactly matches the date of the ClaimPayment it's attached to. See the note under Ledgers.ComputePayments. This will eventually not be used for aging. The ProcDate will instead be used. See ProcDate.

column.name: WriteOff
column.summary: Amount not covered by ins which is written off. The writeoff estimate goes in a different column.

column.name: CodeSent
column.summary: The procedure code that was sent to insurance. This is not necessarily the usual procedure code. It will already have been trimmed to 5 char if it started with "D", or it could be the alternate code. Not allowed to be blank if it is procedure.

column.name: AllowedOverride
column.summary: The allowed fee (not the override) is a complex calculation which is performed on the fly in Procedure.ComputeEstimates/ClaimProc.ComputeBaseEst. It is the amount that the percentage is based on. If this carrier has a lower UCR than the office, then the allowed fee is where that is handled. It can be pulled from an allowed fee schedule. It is also where substitutions for posterior composites are handled. The AllowedOverride allows the user to override the calculation. -1 indicates blank. A new use of this field is for when entering insurance payments. On the eob, it will tell you what the allowed/UCR fee is. The user will now be able to enter this information into the AllowedOverride field. They will simultaneously pass the info to the allowed fee schedule. AllowedOverride is never changed automatically by the program except to sometimes set it to -1 if NoBillIns.

column.name: Percentage
column.summary: -1 if blank. Otherwise a number between 0 and 100. The percentage that insurance pays on this procedure, as determined from insurance categories. Not user editable.

column.name: PercentOverride
column.summary: -1 if blank. Otherwise a number between 0 and 100. Can only be changed by user.

column.name: CopayAmt
column.summary: -1 if blank. Calculated automatically. User cannot edit but can use CopayOverride instead. Opposite of InsEst, because this is the patient portion estimate. Two different uses: 1. For capitation, this automates calculation of writeoff. 2. For any other insurance, it gets deducted during calculation as shown in the edit window. Neither use directly affects patient balance.

column.name: NoBillIns
column.summary: Set to true to not bill to this insurance plan.

column.name: PaidOtherIns
column.summary: -1 if blank. The amount paid or estimated to be paid by another insurance. This amount is then subtracted from what the current insurance would pay. When running the calculation and considering other claimprocs, it will ignore any patPlan with a higher ordinal. So, always blank for primary claims. User cannot edit, but can use PaidOtherInsOverride.

column.name: BaseEst
column.summary: Always has a value. Used in TP, etc. The base estimate is the ((fee or allowedOverride)-Copay) x (percentage or percentOverride). Does not include all the extras like ded, annualMax,and paidOtherIns that InsEstTotal holds. BaseEst cannot be overridden by the user. Instead, the following fields can be manipulated: allowedOverride, CopayOverride, PercentOverride.

column.name: CopayOverride
column.summary: -1 if blank. See description of CopayAmt. This lets the user set a copay that will never be overwritten by automatic calculations.

column.name: ProcDate
column.summary: Date of the procedure. Currently only used for tracking annual insurance benefits remaining. Important in Adjustments to benefits. For total claim payments, MUST be the date of the procedures to correctly figure benefits. Will eventually transition to use this field to actually calculate aging. See the note under Ledgers.ComputePayments.

column.name: DateEntry
column.summary: Date that it was changed to status received or supplemental. It is usually attached to a claimPayment at that point, but not if user forgets. This is still the date that it becomes important financial data. Only applies if Received or Supplemental. Otherwise, the date is disregarded. User may never edit. Important in audit trail.

column.name: LineNumber
column.summary: Assigned when claim is created as a way to order the procs showing on a claim. Really only used in Canadian claims for now as F07.

column.name: DedEst
column.summary: -1 if blank. Not sure why we need to allow -1. Calculated automatically. User cannot edit, but can use DedEstOverride instead.

column.name: DedEstOverride
column.summary: -1 if blank. Overrides the DedEst value.

column.name: InsEstTotal
column.summary: Always has a value. BaseEst-(DedEst or DedEstOverride)-PaidOtherIns-OverAnnualMax. User cannot edit, but can instead use InsEstTotalOverride.

column.name: InsEstTotalOverride
column.summary: -1 if blank. Overrides the InsEstTotal value.

column.name: PaidOtherInsOverride
column.summary: -1 if blank. Overrides the PaidOtherIns value.

column.name: EstimateNote
column.summary: An automatically generated note that displays information about over max, exclusions, and other limitations for which there are no fields. Only applies to estimate. Once it's attached to a claim, similar information can go in the remarks field.

column.name: WriteOffEst
column.summary: -1 if blank. The estimated writeoff as calculated by OD. Usually only used for PPOs.

column.name: WriteOffEstOverride
column.summary: -1 if blank. Overrides WriteOffEst. Usually only used for PPOs.

column.name: ClinicNum
column.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. Can be zero. No user interface for editing. Forced to always be the same as the procedure, or if no procedure, then the claim.

column.name: InsSubNum
column.summary: FK to inssub.InsSubNum.

table.name: clearinghouse
table.summary: Since we can send e-claims to multiple clearinghouses, this table keeps track of each clearinghouse. Will eventually be used for individual carriers as well if they accept

column.name: ClearinghouseNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: Description
column.summary: Description of this clearinghouse

column.name: ExportPath
column.summary: The path to export the X12 file to. \ is now optional.

column.name: IsDefault
column.summary: Set to true if this is the default clearinghouse to which you want most of your e-claims sent.

column.name: Payors
column.summary: A list of all payors which should have claims sent to this clearinghouse. Comma delimited with no spaces. Not necessary if IsDefault.

column.name: Eformat
column.summary: Enum:ElectronicClaimFormat The format of the file that gets sent electronically.

Enumeration.name: ElectronicClaimFormat
Enumeration.summary: For every type of electronic claim format that Open Dental can create, there will be an item in this enumeration. All e-claim formats are hard coded due to complexity.
Enumeration.EnumValue: 0-Not in database, but used in various places in program.
4-CSV file adaptable for use in Netherlands.

column.name: ISA05
column.summary: Sender ID Qualifier. Usually ZZ, sometimes 30. Seven other values are allowed as specified in X12 document, but probably never used.

column.name: SenderTIN
column.summary: Used in ISA06, GS02, 1000A NM1, and 1000A PER. If blank, then 810624427 is used to indicate Open Dental.

column.name: ISA07
column.summary: Receiver ID Qualifier. Usually ZZ, sometimes 30. Seven other values are allowed as specified in X12 document, but probably never used.

column.name: ISA08
column.summary: Receiver ID. Also used in GS03. Provided by clearinghouse. Examples: BCBSGA or 0135WCH00(webMD)

column.name: ISA15
column.summary: "P" for Production or "T" for Test.

column.name: Password
column.summary: Password is usually combined with the login ID for user validation.

column.name: ResponsePath
column.summary: The path that all incoming response files will be saved to. \ is now optional.

column.name: CommBridge
column.summary: Enum:EclaimsCommBridge One of the included hard-coded communications briges. Or none to just create the claim files without uploading.

Enumeration.name: EclaimsCommBridge
Enumeration.summary: Each clearinghouse can have a hard-coded comm bridge which handles all the communications of transfering the claim files to the clearinghouse/carrier. Does not just include X12, but can include any format at all.
Enumeration.EnumValue: 0-No comm bridge will be activated. The claim files will be created to the specified path, but they will not be uploaded.

column.name: ClientProgram
column.summary: If applicable, this is the name of the client program to launch. It is even used by the hard-coded comm bridges, because the user may have changed the installation directory or exe name.

column.name: LastBatchNumber
column.summary: Each clearinghouse increments their batch numbers by one each time a claim file is sent. User never sees this number. Maxes out at 999, then loops back to 1. This field must NOT be cached and must be ignored in the code except where it explicitly retrieves it from the db. Defaults to 0 for brand new clearinghouses, which causes the first batch to go out as #1.

column.name: ModemPort
column.summary: Was not used. 1,2,3,or 4. The port that the modem is connected to if applicable. Always uses 9600 baud and standard settings. Will crash if port or modem not valid.

column.name: LoginID
column.summary: A clearinghouse usually has a login ID that is used with the password in order to access the remote server. This value is not usualy used within the actual claim.

column.name: SenderName
column.summary: Used in 1000A NM1 and 1000A PER. But if SenderTIN is blank, then OPEN DENTAL SOFTWARE is used instead.

column.name: SenderTelephone
column.summary: Used in 1000A PER. But if SenderTIN is blank, then 8776861248 is used instead. 10 digit phone is required by WebMD and is universally assumed, so for now, this must be either blank or 10 digits.

column.name: GS03
column.summary: Usually the same as ISA08, but at least one clearinghouse uses a different number here.

table.name: clinic
table.summary: A clinic is usually a separate physical office location. If multiple clinics are sharing one database, then this is used. Patients, Operatories, Claims, and many other types of objects can be assigned to a clinic.

column.name: ClinicNum
column.summary: Primary key. Used in patient,payment,claimpayment,appointment,procedurelog, etc.

column.name: Address2
column.summary: Second line of address.

column.name: State
column.summary: 2 char in the US.

column.name: Phone
column.summary: Does not include any punctuation. Should be exactly 10 digits

column.name: BankNumber
column.summary: The account number for deposits.

column.name: DefaultPlaceService
column.summary: Enum:PlaceOfService Usually 0 unless a mobile clinic for instance.

Enumeration.name: PlaceOfService
Enumeration.EnumValue: 5. CPT code 33. In X12, a similar code AdultLivCareFac 35 is mentioned.
6. CPT code ?. We use 11 for office.

column.name: InsBillingProv
column.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum. 0=Default practice provider, -1=Treating provider.

table.name: clockevent
table.summary: One clock-in / clock-out pair. Of, if the pair is a break, then it's an out/in pair. With normal clock in/out pairs, we want to know how long the employee was working. It's the opposite with breaks. We want to know how long they were not working, so the pair is backwards. This means that a normal clock in is left incomplete when the clock out for break is created. And once both are finished, the regular in/out will surround the break. Breaks cannot be viewed easily on the same grid as regular clock events for this reason. And since breaks do not affect pay, they should not clutter the normal grid.

column.name: ClockEventNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: EmployeeNum
column.summary: FK to employee.EmployeeNum

column.name: TimeEntered1
column.summary: The actual time that this entry was entered. Cannot be 01-01-0001.

column.name: TimeDisplayed1
column.summary: The time to display and to use in all calculations. Cannot be 01-01-0001.

column.name: ClockStatus
column.summary: Enum:TimeClockStatus Home, Lunch, or Break. The status really only applies to the clock out. Except the Break status applies to both out and in.

column.name: TimeEntered2
column.summary: The user can never edit this, but the program has to be able to edit this when user clocks out. Can be 01-01-0001 if not clocked out yet.

column.name: TimeDisplayed2
column.summary: User can edit. Can be 01-01-0001 if not clocked out yet.

column.name: OTimeHours
column.summary: This is a manual override for OTimeAuto. Typically -1 hour (-01:00:00) to indicate no override. When used as override, allowed values are zero or positive. This is an alternative to using a TimeAdjust row.

column.name: OTimeAuto
column.summary: Automatically calculated OT. Will be zero if none.

column.name: Adjust
column.summary: This is a manual override of AdjustAuto. Ignored unless AdjustIsOverridden set to true. When used as override, it's typically negative, although zero and positive are also allowed.

column.name: AdjustAuto
column.summary: Automatically calculated Adjust. Will be zero if none.

column.name: AdjustIsOverridden
column.summary: True if AdjustAuto is overridden by Adjust.

table.name: commlog
table.summary: Tracks all forms of communications with patients, including emails, phonecalls, postcards, etc.

column.name: CommlogNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: PatNum
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

column.name: CommDateTime
column.summary: Date and time of entry

column.name: CommType
column.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. This will be 0 if IsStatementSent. Used to be an enumeration in previous versions.

column.name: Note
column.summary: Note for this commlog entry.

column.name: Mode_
column.summary: Enum:CommItemMode Phone, email, etc.

column.name: SentOrReceived
column.summary: Enum:CommSentOrReceived Neither=0,Sent=1,Received=2.

Enumeration.name: CommSentOrReceived
Enumeration.summary: 0=neither, 1=sent, 2=received.

column.name: UserNum
column.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.

column.name: Signature
column.summary: Signature. For details, see procedurelog.Signature.

column.name: SigIsTopaz
column.summary: True if signed using the Topaz signature pad, false otherwise.

column.name: DateTStamp
column.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed.

table.name: computer
table.summary: Keeps track of the computers in an office. The list will eventually become cluttered with the names of old computers that are no longer in service. The old rows can be safely deleted. Although the primary key is used in at least one table, this will probably be changed, and the computername will become the primary key.

column.name: ComputerNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: CompName
column.summary: Name of the computer.

column.name: LastHeartBeat
column.summary: Allows use to tell which computers are running. All workstations record a heartbeat here at an interval of 3 minutes. And when they shut down, they set this value to min. So if the heartbeat is fairly fresh, then that's an accurate indicator of whether the computer is running.

table.name: computerpref
table.summary: Enables preference specification for individual computers on a customer network.

column.name: ComputerPrefNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: ComputerName
column.summary: The human-readable name of the computer on the network (not the IP address).

column.name: GraphicsUseHardware
column.summary: Set to true if the tooth chart is to use a hardware accelerated OpenGL window when available. Set to false to use software rendering when available. Of course, the final pixel format on the customer machine depends on the list of available formats. Best match pixel format is always used. This option only applies if GraphicsSimple is set to false.

column.name: GraphicsSimple
column.summary: Enum:DrawingMode Set to 1 to use the low-quality 2D tooth chart in the chart module. Set to 0 to use a 3D DirectX based tooth chart in the chart module. This option helps the program run even when the local graphics hardware is buggy or unavailable.

column.name: SensorType
column.summary: Indicates the type of Suni sensor connected to the local computer (if any). This can be a value of A, B, C, or D.

column.name: SensorBinned
column.summary: Indicates wether or not the Suni sensor uses binned operation.

column.name: SensorPort
column.summary: Indicates which Suni box port to connect with. There are 2 ports on a box (ports 0 and 1).

column.name: SensorExposure
column.summary: Indicates the exposure level to use when capturing from a Suni sensor. Values can be 1 through 7.

column.name: GraphicsDoubleBuffering
column.summary: Indicates if the user prefers double-buffered 3D tooth-chart (where applicable).

column.name: PreferredPixelFormatNum
column.summary: Indicates the current pixel format by number which the user prefers.

column.name: AtoZpath
column.summary: The path of the A-Z folder for the specified computer. Overrides the officewide default. Used when multiple locations are on a single virtual database and they each want to look to the local data folder for images.

column.name: TaskKeepListHidden
column.summary: If the global setting for showing the Task List is on, this controls if it should be hidden on this specified computer

column.name: TaskDock
column.summary: Dock task bar on bottom (0) or right (1).

column.name: TaskX
column.summary: X pos for right docked task list.

column.name: TaskY
column.summary: Y pos for bottom docked task list.

column.name: DirectXFormat
column.summary: Holds a semi-colon separated list of enumeration names and values representing a DirectX format. If blank, then no format is currently set and the best theoretical foramt will be chosen at program startup. If this value is set to 'opengl' then this computer is using OpenGL and a DirectX format will not be picked.

table.name: contact
table.summary: Like a rolodex for businesses that the office interacts with. Used to store pharmacies, etc.

column.name: ContactNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: LName
column.summary: Last name or, frequently, the entire name.

column.name: FName
column.summary: First name is optional.

column.name: WkPhone
column.summary: Work phone.

column.name: Fax
column.summary: Fax number.

column.name: Category
column.summary: FK to definition.DefNum

column.name: Notes
column.summary: Note for this contact.

table.name: county
table.summary: Used in public health.

column.name: CountyName
column.summary: Primary key, but allowed to change. Change is programmatically synchronized.

column.name: CountyCode
column.summary: Optional. Usage varies.

table.name: covcat
table.summary: Insurance coverage categories. They need to look like in the manual for the American calculations to work properly.

column.name: CovCatNum
column.summary: Primary key. Only used in Benefit and CovSpan tables.

column.name: Description
column.summary: Description of this category.

column.name: DefaultPercent
column.summary: Default percent for this category. -1 to skip this category and not apply a percentage.

column.name: CovOrder
column.summary: The order in which the categories are displayed. Includes hidden categories. 0-based.

column.name: IsHidden
column.summary: If true, this category will be hidden.

column.name: EbenefitCat
column.summary: Enum:EbenefitCategory The X12 benefit categories. Each CovCat can link to one X12 category. Default is 0 (unlinked).

Enumeration.name: EbenefitCategory
Enumeration.summary: The X12 benefit categories. Used to link the user-defined CovCats to the corresponding X12 category.
Enumeration.EnumValue: 1- X12: 30 and 35. All ADA codes except ortho. D0000-D7999 and D9000-D9999
2- X12: 23. ADA D0000-D0999. This includes DiagnosticXray.
7- X12: 36. Exclusive subcategory of restorative. D2700-D2799
13- X12: 4. ADA D0200-D0399. So this is like an optional category which is otherwise considered to be diagnosic.

table.name: covspan
table.summary: Always attached to covcats, this describes the span of procedure codes to which the category applies.

column.name: CovSpanNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: CovCatNum
column.summary: FK to covcat.CovCatNum.

column.name: FromCode
column.summary: Lower range of the span. Does not need to be a valid code.

column.name: ToCode
column.summary: Upper range of the span. Does not need to be a valid code.

table.name: definition
table.summary: The info in the definition table is used by other tables extensively. Almost every table in the database links to definition. Almost all links to this table will be to a DefNum. Using the DefNum, you can find any of the other fields of interest, usually the ItemName. Make sure to look at the Defs class to see how the definitions are used. Loaded into memory ahead of time for speed. Some types of info such as operatories started out life in this table, but then got moved to their own table when more complexity was needed.

column.name: DefNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: Category
column.summary: Enum:DefCat

Enumeration.name: DefCat
Enumeration.summary: Definition Category. Go to the definition setup window in the program to see how each of these categories is used.
Enumeration.EnumValue: 0- Colors to display in Account module.
3- Procedure quick add list for appointments.
13- Statuses for recall, unscheduled, and next appointments.
17- Colors to display in the Appointments module.
19- Quick add notes for the ApptPhoneNotes, which is getting phased out.
22- Colors for the graphical tooth chart.
26- Categories of procedure buttons in Chart module
29- Types of unearned income used in accrual accounting.

column.name: ItemOrder
column.summary: Order that each item shows on various lists.

column.name: ItemName
column.summary: Each category is a little different. This field is usually the common name of the item.

column.name: ItemValue
column.summary: This field can be used to store extra info about the item.

column.name: ItemColor
column.summary: Some categories include a color option.

column.name: IsHidden
column.summary: If hidden, the item will not show on any list, but can still be referenced.

table.name: deletedobject
table.summary: When some objects are deleted, we sometimes need a way to track them for synching purposes. Other objects already have fields for IsHidden or PatStatus which track deletions just fine. Those types of objects will not use this table.

column.name: DeletedObjectNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: ObjectNum
column.summary: Foreign key to a number of different tables, depending on which type it is.

column.name: ObjectType
column.summary: Enum:DeletedObjectType

column.name: DateTStamp
column.summary: Updated any time the row is altered in any way.

table.name: deposit
table.summary: A deposit slip. Contains multiple insurance and patient checks.

column.name: DepositNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: DateDeposit
column.summary: The date of the deposit.

column.name: BankAccountInfo
column.summary: User editable. Usually includes name on the account and account number. Possibly the bank name as well.

column.name: Amount
column.summary: Total amount of the deposit. User not allowed to directly edit.

table.name: disease
table.summary: Each row is one disease that one patient has. A disease is a medical condition or allergy. Diseases are defined in the DiseaseDef table.

column.name: DiseaseNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: PatNum
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum

column.name: DiseaseDefNum
column.summary: FK to diseasedef.DiseaseDefNum. The disease description is in that table.

column.name: PatNote
column.summary: Any note about this disease that is specific to this patient.

table.name: diseasedef
table.summary: A list of diseases that can be assigned to patients. Cannot be deleted if in use by any patients.

column.name: DiseaseDefNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: ItemOrder
column.summary: The order that the diseases will show in various lists.

column.name: IsHidden
column.summary: If hidden, the disease will still show on any patient that it was previously attached to, but it will not be available for future patients.

table.name: displayfield
table.summary: Allows customization of which fields display in various lists and grids. For now, the only grid is ProgressNotes. Will also eventually let users set column widths and translate titles. For now, the selections are the same for all computers.

column.name: DisplayFieldNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: InternalName
column.summary: This is the internal name that OD uses to identify the field within this category. This will be the default description if the user doesn't specify an alternate.

column.name: ItemOrder
column.summary: Order to display in the grid or list. Every entry must have a unique itemorder.

column.name: Description
column.summary: Optional alternate description to display for field. Can be in another language.

column.name: ColumnWidth
column.summary: For grid columns, this lets user override the column width. Especially useful for foreign languages.

column.name: Category
column.summary: Enum:DisplayFieldCategory. If category is 0, then this is attached to a ChartView.

column.name: ChartViewNum
column.summary: FK to chartview.ChartViewNum. 0 if attached to a category.

table.name: document
table.summary: It should be called image, but the name is for historical reasons. Represents a single document in the images module.

column.name: DocNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: Description
column.summary: Description of the document.

column.name: DateCreated
column.summary: Date created.

column.name: DocCategory
column.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. Categories for documents.

column.name: PatNum
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. Patient folder that document is in.(for sharing situations later)

column.name: FileName
column.summary: The name of the file. Does not include any directory info.

column.name: ImgType
column.summary: Enum:ImageType eg. document, radiograph, photo, file

Enumeration.name: ImageType
Enumeration.summary: The type of image for images module.
Enumeration.EnumValue: 3- For instance a Word document or a spreadsheet. Not an image.

column.name: IsFlipped
column.summary: True if flipped horizontally. A vertical flip would be stored as a horizontal flip plus a 180 rotation.

column.name: DegreesRotated
column.summary: Only allowed 0,90,180, and 270.

column.name: ToothNumbers
column.summary: Incomplete. An optional list of tooth numbers separated by commas. The tooth numbers will be in American format and must be processed for display. When displayed, dashes will be used for sequences of 3 or more tooth numbers.

column.name: SigIsTopaz
column.summary: True if the signature is in Topaz format rather than OD format.

column.name: Signature
column.summary: The encrypted and bound signature in base64 format. The signature is bound to the byte sequence of the original image.

column.name: CropX
column.summary: Crop rectangle X in original image pixel coordinates. May be negative.

column.name: CropY
column.summary: Crop rectangle Y in original image pixel coordinates. May be negative.

column.name: CropW
column.summary: Crop rectangle Width in original image pixel coordinates. May be zero if no cropping. May be greater than original image width.

column.name: CropH
column.summary: Crop rectangle Height in original image pixel coordinates. May be zero if no cropping. May be greater than original image height.

column.name: WindowingMin
column.summary: The lower value of the "windowing" (contrast/brightness) for radiographs. Default is 0. Max is 255.

column.name: WindowingMax
column.summary: The upper value of the "windowing" (contrast/brightness) for radiographs. Default is 0(no windowing). Max is 255.

column.name: MountItemNum
column.summary: FK to mountitem.MountItemNum. If set to 0, then no mount item is associated with this document.

column.name: DateTStamp
column.summary: Date/time last altered.

table.name: dunning
table.summary: A message that will show on certain patient statements when printing bills. Criteria must be met in order for the dunning message to show.

column.name: DunningNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: DunMessage
column.summary: The actual dunning message that will go on the patient bill.

column.name: BillingType
column.summary: FK to definition.DefNum.

column.name: AgeAccount
column.summary: This is an long field, but program forces only 0,30,60,or 90.

column.name: InsIsPending
column.summary: Enum:YN Set Y to only show if insurance is pending.

Enumeration.name: YN
Enumeration.summary: Unknown,Yes, or No.

column.name: MessageBold
column.summary: A message that will be copied to the NoteBold field of the Statement.

table.name: electid
table.summary: Corresponds to the electid table in the database. Never editable by users. We keep this table updated with new numbers as part of upgrades, so never edit this table as it will mess up our primary keys. Helps with entering elecronic/payor id's as well as keeping track of the specific carrier requirements. Only used by the X12 format.

column.name: ElectIDNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: PayorID
column.summary: aka Electronic ID. A simple string.

column.name: CarrierName
column.summary: As published. Not editable. Used when doing a search.

column.name: IsMedicaid
column.summary: True if medicaid. Then, the billing and treating providers will have their Medicaid ID's attached.

column.name: ProviderTypes
column.summary: Integers separated by commas. Each long represents a ProviderSupplementalID type that is required by this insurance. Usually only used for BCBS or other carriers that require supplemental provider id's. Even if we don't put the supplemental types in here, the user can still add them. This just helps by doing an additional check for known required types.

column.name: Comments
column.summary: Any comments. Usually includes enrollment requirements and descriptions of how to use the provider id's supplied by the carrier because they might call them by different names.

table.name: emailattach
table.summary: Keeps track of one file attached to an email. Multiple files can be attached to an email using this method.

column.name: EmailAttachNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: EmailMessageNum
column.summary: FK to emailmessage.EmailMessageNum

column.name: DisplayedFileName
column.summary: The name of the file that shows on the email. For example: tooth2.jpg.

column.name: ActualFileName
column.summary: The actual file is stored in the A-Z folder in EmailAttachments. This field stores the name of the file. The files are named automatically based on Date/time along with a random number. This ensures that they will be sequential as well as unique.

table.name: emailmessage
table.summary: An outgoing email message is stored here.

column.name: EmailMessageNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: PatNum
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum

column.name: ToAddress
column.summary: Single valid email address. Bcc field might be added later, although it won't be very useful. We will never allow visible cc for privacy reasons.

column.name: FromAddress
column.summary: Valid email address.

column.name: Subject
column.summary: Subject line.

column.name: BodyText
column.summary: Body of the email

column.name: MsgDateTime
column.summary: Date and time the message was sent. Automated field.

column.name: SentOrReceived
column.summary: 0=neither, 1=sent, 2=received.

table.name: emailtemplate
table.summary: A template email which can be used as the basis for a new email.

column.name: EmailTemplateNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: Subject
column.summary: Default subject line.

column.name: BodyText
column.summary: Body of the email

table.name: employee
table.summary: An employee at the dental office.

column.name: EmployeeNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: LName
column.summary: Employee's last name.

column.name: FName
column.summary: First name.

column.name: MiddleI
column.summary: Middle initial or name.

column.name: IsHidden
column.summary: If hidden, the employee will not show on the list.

column.name: ClockStatus
column.summary: This is just text used to quickly display the clockstatus. eg Working,Break,Lunch,Home, etc.

column.name: PhoneExt
column.summary: The phone extension for the employee. e.g. 101,102,etc. This field is only visible for user editing if the pref DockPhonePanelShow is true (1).

table.name: employer
table.summary: Most insurance plans are organized by employer. This table keeps track of the list of employers. The address fields were added at one point, but I don't know why they don't show in the program in order to edit. Nobody has noticed their absence even though it's been a few years, so for now we are just using the EmpName and not the address.

column.name: EmployerNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: EmpName
column.summary: Name of the employer.

column.name: Address2
column.summary: Second line of address.

column.name: State
column.summary: 2 char in the US.

column.name: Phone
column.summary: Includes any punctuation.

column.name: EquipmentNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: Description
column.summary: Short description, need not be very unique.

column.name: SerialNumber
column.summary: Must be unique among all pieces of equipment. Auto-generated 3 char alpha numeric gives 1.5M unique serial numbers. Zero never part of autogenerated serial number.

column.name: ModelYear
column.summary: Limit 2 char.

column.name: DatePurchased
column.summary: Date when this corporation obtained the equipment. Always has a valid value.

column.name: DateSold
column.summary: Normally 01-01-0001 if equipment still in possession. Once sold, a date will be present.

column.name: DateEntry
column.summary: Security uses this date to lock older entries from accidental deletion.

table.name: etrans
table.summary: One electronic transaction. Typically, one claim or response. Or one benefit request or response. Is constantly being expanded to include more types of transactions with clearinghouses. Also stores printing of paper claims. Sometimes stores a copy of what was sent.

column.name: EtransNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: DateTimeTrans
column.summary: The date and time of the transaction.

column.name: ClearingHouseNum
column.summary: FK to clearinghouse.ClearinghouseNum . Can be 0 if no clearinghouse was involved.

column.name: Etype
column.summary: Enum:EtransType

Enumeration.name: EtransType
Enumeration.summary: The _CA of some types should get stripped off when displaying to users.
Enumeration.EnumValue: 23 Text report from clearinghouse in human readable format.
When a Canadian message is sent, and an error comes back instead of a message. This store information about the error. The etrans with this type is attached it to the original etrans as an ack.

column.name: ClaimNum
column.summary: FK to claim.ClaimNum if a claim. Otherwise 0. Warning. Original claim might have been deleted. But if Canadian claim was successfully sent, then deletion will be blocked.

column.name: OfficeSequenceNumber
column.summary: For Canada. Unique for every transaction sent. Increments by one until 999999, then resets to 1.

column.name: CarrierTransCounter
column.summary: For Canada. Separate counter for each carrier. Increments by one until 99999, then resets to 1.

column.name: CarrierTransCounter2
column.summary: For Canada. If this claim includes secondary, then this is the counter for the secondary carrier.

column.name: CarrierNum
column.summary: FK to carrier.CarrierNum.

column.name: CarrierNum2
column.summary: FK to carrier.CarrierNum Only used if secondary insurance info is provided on a claim. Necessary for Canada.

column.name: PatNum
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum This is useful in case the original claim has been deleted. Now, we can still tell who the patient was.

column.name: BatchNumber
column.summary: Maxes out at 999, then loops back to 1. This is not a good key, but is a restriction of (canadian?). So dates must also be used to isolate the correct BatchNumber key. Specific to one clearinghouse. Only used with e-claims. Claim will have BatchNumber, and 997 will have matching BatchNumber. (In X12 lingo, it's a functional group number)

column.name: AckCode
column.summary: A=Accepted, R=Rejected, blank if not able to parse. More options will be added later. The incoming 997 sets this flag automatically. To find the 997, look for a matching BatchNumber with a similar date, since both the claims and the 997 will both have the same batch number. The 997 does not have this flag set on itself.

column.name: TransSetNum
column.summary: For sent e-claims, within each batch (functional group), each carrier gets it's own transaction set. Since 997s acknowledge transaction sets rather than batches, we need to keep track of which transaction set each claim is part of as well as which batch it's part of. This field can't be set as part of 997, because one 997 refers to multiple trans sets.

column.name: Note
column.summary: Typical uses include indicating that the report was printed, the claim was resent, reason for rejection, etc. For a 270, this contains the automatically generated short summary of the response. The response could include the reason for failure, or it could be a short summary of the 271.

column.name: EtransMessageTextNum
column.summary: FK to etransmessagetext.EtransMessageTextNum. Can be 0 if there is no message text. Multiple Etrans objects can refer to the same message text, very common in a batch.

column.name: AckEtransNum
column.summary: FK to etrans.EtransNum. Only has a non-zero value if there exists an ack etrans, like a 997, 271, or ackError. There can be only one ack for any given etrans, but one ack can apply to multiple etran's that were sent as one batch.

column.name: PlanNum
column.summary: FK to insplan.PlanNum. Used if EtransType.BenefitInquiry270 and BenefitResponse271.

column.name: InsSubNum
column.summary: FK to inssub.InsSubNum. Used if EtransType.BenefitInquiry270 and BenefitResponse271.

table.name: etransmessagetext
table.summary: Each row is big. The entire X12 message text is stored here, since it can be the same for multiple etrans objects, and since the messages can be so big.

column.name: EtransMessageTextNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: MessageText
column.summary: The entire message text, including carriage returns.

table.name: fee
table.summary: There is one entry in this table for each fee for a single procedurecode. So if there are 5 different fees stored for one procedurecode, then there will be five entries here.

column.name: FeeNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: Amount
column.summary: The amount usually charged. If an amount is unknown, then the entire Fee entry is deleted from the database. The absence of a fee is sometimes shown in the user interface as a blank entry, and sometimes as 0.00.

column.name: OldCode
column.summary: Do not use.

column.name: FeeSched
column.summary: FK to feesched.FeeSchedNum.

column.name: UseDefaultFee
column.summary: Not used.

column.name: UseDefaultCov
column.summary: Not used.

column.name: CodeNum
column.summary: FK to procedurecode.CodeNum.

table.name: feesched
table.summary: Fee schedule names used to be in the definition table, but now they have their own table. We are about to have many many more fee schedules as we start automating allowed fees.

column.name: FeeSchedNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: Description
column.summary: The name of the fee schedule.

column.name: FeeSchedType
column.summary: Enum:FeeScheduleType

column.name: ItemOrder
column.summary: Unlike with the old definition table, this ItemOrder is not as critical in the caching of data. The item order is only for fee schedules of the same type.

column.name: IsHidden
column.summary: True if the fee schedule is hidden. Can't delete fee schedules or change their type once created.

table.name: files
table.summary: As an alternative to storing files in the os file system, they may be stored here, in the database.

column.name: DocNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: Data
column.summary: longblob

column.name: Thumbnail
column.summary: longblob

table.name: formpat
table.summary: One form or questionnaire filled out by a patient. Each patient can have multiple forms.

column.name: FormPatNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: PatNum
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

column.name: FormDateTime
column.summary: The date and time that this questionnaire was filled out.

table.name: grouppermission
table.summary: Every user group has certain permissions. This defines a permission for a group. The absense of permission would cause that row to be deleted from this table.

column.name: GroupPermNum
