column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: NewerDate
column.summary: Only granted permission if newer than this date. Can be Minimum (01-01-0001) to always grant permission.

column.name: NewerDays
column.summary: Can be 0 to always grant permission. Otherwise, only granted permission if item is newer than the given number of days. 1 would mean only if entered today.

column.name: UserGroupNum
column.summary: FK to usergroup.UserGroupNum. The user group for which this permission is granted. If not authorized, then this groupPermission will have been deleted.

column.name: PermType
column.summary: Enum:Permissions

Enumeration.name: Permissions
Enumeration.summary: A hard-coded list of permissions which may be granted to usergroups.
Enumeration.EnumValue: 8. Currently covers a wide variety of setup functions.
24. At least one user must have this permission.
37- Also includes completed claimprocs even if unattached to an insurance check. However, it's not actually enforced when creating a check because it would be very complex.
41 All other equipment functions are covered by .Setup. Uses date restrictions.

column.name: GuardianNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: PatNumChild
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

column.name: PatNumGuardian
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

column.name: Relationship
column.summary: Enum:GuardianRelationship Father, Mother, Stepfather, Stepmother, Grandfather, Grandmother, Sitter.

Enumeration.name: GuardianRelationship
Enumeration.summary: Relationship of a child to a parent/guardian.

table.name: hl7msg
table.summary: HL7 messages sent and received.

column.name: HL7MsgNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: HL7Status
column.summary: Enum:HL7MessageStatus OutPending, OutSent, InReceived, InProcessed.

column.name: MsgText
column.summary: The actual HL7 message in its entirity.

column.name: AptNum
column.summary: FK to appointment.AptNum. Many of the messages contain "Visit ID" which is equivalent to the our AptNum.

table.name: insfilingcode
table.summary: An optional field on insplan and claims. This lets user customize so that they can track insurance types.

column.name: InsFilingCodeNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: Descript
column.summary: Description of the insurance filing code.

column.name: EclaimCode
column.summary: Code for electronic claim.

column.name: ItemOrder
column.summary: Display order for this filing code within the UI. 0-indexed.

table.name: insfilingcodesubtype
table.summary: Stores the list of insurance filing code subtypes.

column.name: InsFilingCodeNum
column.summary: FK to insfilingcode.insfilingcodenum

column.name: Descript
column.summary: The description of the insurance filing code subtype.

table.name: insplan
table.summary: Subscribers can share insplans by using the InsSub table. The patplan table determines coverage for individual patients. InsPlans can also exist without any subscriber.

column.name: PlanNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: GroupName
column.summary: Optional

column.name: GroupNum
column.summary: Optional. In Canada, this is called the Plan Number.

column.name: PlanNote
column.summary: Note for all plans identical to this one. Always stays in synch with other identical plans regardless of user actions. If they change it on one, it gets changed on all.

column.name: FeeSched
column.summary: FK to feesched.FeeSchedNum.

column.name: PlanType
column.summary: ""=percentage(the default),"p"=ppo_percentage,"f"=flatCopay,"c"=capitation.

column.name: ClaimFormNum
column.summary: FK to claimform.ClaimFormNum. eg. "1" for ADA2002. For ADA2006, it varies by office.

column.name: UseAltCode
column.summary: 0=no,1=yes. could later be extended if more alternates required

column.name: ClaimsUseUCR
column.summary: Fee billed on claim should be the UCR fee for the patient's provider.

column.name: CopayFeeSched
column.summary: FK to feesched.FeeSchedNum. Not usually used. This fee schedule holds only co-pays(patient portions). Only used for Capitation or for fixed copay plans.

column.name: EmployerNum
column.summary: FK to employer.EmployerNum.

column.name: CarrierNum
column.summary: FK to carrier.CarrierNum.

column.name: AllowedFeeSched
column.summary: FK to feesched.FeeSchedNum. Not usually used. This fee schedule holds amounts allowed by carriers.

column.name: DivisionNo
column.summary: Only used in Canada. It's a suffix to the plan number (group number).

column.name: IsMedical
column.summary: True if this is medical insurance rather than dental insurance.

column.name: FilingCode
column.summary: FK to insfilingcode.InsFilingCodeNum. Used for e-claims. Also used for some complex reports in public health. The e-claim usage might become obsolete when PlanID implemented by HIPAA. Can be 0 to indicate none. Then 'CI' will go out on claims.

column.name: DentaideCardSequence
column.summary: Canadian e-claim field. D11 and E07. Zero indicates empty. Mandatory value for Dentaide. Not used for all others. 2 digit.

column.name: ShowBaseUnits
column.summary: If checked, the units Qty will show the base units assigned to a procedure on the claim form.

column.name: CodeSubstNone
column.summary: Set to true to not allow procedure code downgrade substitution on this insurance plan.

column.name: IsHidden
column.summary: Set to true to hide it from the pick list and from the main list.

column.name: MonthRenew
column.summary: The month, 1 through 12 when the insurance plan renews. It will renew on the first of the month. To indicate calendar year, set renew month to 0.

column.name: FilingCodeSubtype
column.summary: FK to insfilingcodesubtype.insfilingcodesubtypenum

column.name: CanadianPlanFlag
column.summary: Canadian C12. Single char, usually blank. A=Newfoundland MCP Plan - Provincial Medical Plan. V=Veteran's Affairs Plan. N=NIHB(poorly documented). If N, then it does not go out in messages, blank is sent instead. At least that's the way to make in comply with the scripts; see Elig5.

table.name: inssub
table.summary: Multiple subscribers can have the same insurance plan. But the patplan table is still what determines coverage for individual patients.

column.name: InsSubNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: PlanNum
column.summary: FK to insplan.PlanNum.

column.name: Subscriber
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

column.name: DateEffective
column.summary: Date plan became effective.

column.name: DateTerm
column.summary: Date plan was terminated

column.name: ReleaseInfo
column.summary: Release of information signature is on file.

column.name: AssignBen
column.summary: Assignment of benefits signature is on file. For Canada, this handles Payee Code, F01. Option to pay other third party is not included.

column.name: SubscriberID
column.summary: Usually SSN, but can also be changed by user. No dashes. Not allowed to be blank.

column.name: BenefitNotes
column.summary: User doesn't usually put these in. Only used when automatically requesting benefits, such as with Trojan. All the benefits get stored here in text form for later reference. Not at plan level because might be specific to subscriber. If blank, we try to display a benefitNote for another subscriber to the plan.

column.name: SubscNote
column.summary: Use to store any other info that affects coverage.

table.name: instructor
table.summary: Was used by dental schools. Obsolete.

table.name: journalentry
table.summary: Used in accounting to represent a single credit or debit entry. There will always be at least 2 journal enties attached to every transaction. All transactions balance to 0.

column.name: JournalEntryNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: TransactionNum
column.summary: FK to transaction.TransactionNum

column.name: AccountNum
column.summary: FK to account.AccountNum

column.name: DateDisplayed
column.summary: Always the same for all journal entries within one transaction.

column.name: DebitAmt
column.summary: Negative numbers never allowed.

column.name: CreditAmt
column.summary: Negative numbers never allowed.

column.name: Splits
column.summary: A human-readable description of the splits. Used only for display purposes.

column.name: CheckNumber
column.summary: Any user-defined string. Usually a check number, but can also be D for deposit, Adj, etc.

column.name: ReconcileNum
column.summary: FK to reconcile.ReconcileNum. 0 if not attached to a reconcile. Not allowed to alter amounts if attached.

table.name: labcase
table.summary: A lab case.

column.name: LabCaseNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: PatNum
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

column.name: LaboratoryNum
column.summary: FK to laboratory.LaboratoryNum. The lab that the case gets sent to.

column.name: AptNum
column.summary: FK to appointment.AptNum. This is how a lab case is attached to a scheduled appointment. 1:1 relationship for now. Only one labcase per appointment, and (obviously) only one appointment per labcase. Labcase can exist without being attached to any appointments at all, making this zero.

column.name: PlannedAptNum
column.summary: FK to appointment.AptNum. This is how a lab case is attached to a planned appointment in addition to the scheduled appointment.

column.name: DateTimeDue
column.summary: The due date that is put on the labslip. NOT when you really need the labcase back, which is usually a day or two later and is the date of the appointment this case is attached to.

column.name: DateTimeCreated
column.summary: When this lab case was created. User can edit.

column.name: DateTimeSent
column.summary: Time that it actually went out to the lab.

column.name: DateTimeRecd
column.summary: Date/time received back from the lab. If this is filled, then the case is considered received.

column.name: DateTimeChecked
column.summary: Date/time that quality was checked. It is now completely ready for the patient.

column.name: ProvNum
column.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

column.name: Instructions
column.summary: The text instructions for this labcase.

column.name: LabFee
column.summary: There is no UI built yet for this field. Plugins might be making use of this field.

table.name: laboratory
table.summary: A dental laboratory. Will be attached to lab cases.

column.name: LaboratoryNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: Description
column.summary: Description of lab.

column.name: Phone
column.summary: Freeform text includes punctuation.

column.name: Notes
column.summary: Any notes. No practical limit to amount of text.

column.name: Slip
column.summary: FK to sheetdef.SheetDefNum. Lab slips can be set for individual laboratories. If zero, then the default internal lab slip will be used instead of a custom lab slip.

table.name: labturnaround
table.summary: The amount of time it takes for a lab case to be processed at the lab. Used to compute due dates.

column.name: LabTurnaroundNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: LaboratoryNum
column.summary: FK to laboratory.LaboratoryNum. The lab that this item is attached to.

column.name: Description
column.summary: The description of the service that the lab is performing.

column.name: DaysPublished
column.summary: The number of days that the lab publishes as the turnaround time for the service.

column.name: DaysActual
column.summary: The actual number of days. Might be longer than DaysPublished due to travel time. This is what the actual calculations will be done on.

table.name: language
table.summary: This is a list of phrases that need to be translated. The primary key is a combination of the ClassType and the English phrase. This table is currently filled dynmically at run time, but the plan is to fill it using a tool that parses the code.

column.name: EnglishComments
column.summary: No longer used.

column.name: ClassType
column.summary: A string representing the class where the translation is used. Maximum length is 25 characters.

column.name: English
column.summary: The English version of the phrase, case sensitive.

column.name: IsObsolete
column.summary: As this gets more sophisticated, we will use this field to mark some phrases obsolete instead of just deleting them outright. That way, translators will still have access to them. For now, this is not used at all.

table.name: languageforeign
table.summary: Will usually only contain translations for a single foreign language, although more are allowed. The primary key is a combination of the ClassType and the English phrase and the culture.

column.name: ClassType
column.summary: A string representing the class where the translation is used.

column.name: English
column.summary: The English version of the phrase. Case sensitive.

column.name: Culture
column.summary: The specific culture name. Almost always in 5 digit format like this: en-US.

column.name: Translation
column.summary: The foreign translation. Remember we use Unicode-8, so this translation can be in any language, including Russian, Hebrew, and Chinese.

column.name: Comments
column.summary: Comments for other translators for the foreign language.

table.name: letter
table.summary: These are templates that are used to send simple letters to patients.

column.name: LetterNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: Description
column.summary: Description of the Letter.

column.name: BodyText
column.summary: Text of the letter

table.name: lettermerge
table.summary: Describes the templates for letter merges to Word.

column.name: LetterMergeNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: Description
column.summary: Description of this letter.

column.name: TemplateName
column.summary: The filename of the Word template. eg MyTemplate.doc.

column.name: DataFileName
column.summary: The name of the data file. eg MyTemplate.txt.

column.name: Category
column.summary: FK to definition.DefNum.

table.name: lettermergefield
table.summary: When doing a lettermerge, a data file is created with certain fields. This is a list of those fields for each lettermerge.

column.name: FieldNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: LetterMergeNum
column.summary: FK to lettermerge.LetterMergeNum.

column.name: FieldName
column.summary: One of the preset available field names.

table.name: medication
table.summary: A list of medications, not attached to any particular patient. Not allowed to delete if in use by a patient. Not allowed to edit name once created due to possibility of damage to patient record.

column.name: MedicationNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: MedName
column.summary: Name of the medication.

column.name: GenericNum
column.summary: FK to medication.MedicationNum. If this is a generic drug, then the GenericNum will be the same as the MedicationNum.

column.name: Notes
column.summary: Notes.

table.name: medicationpat
table.summary: Links medications to patients.

column.name: MedicationPatNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: PatNum
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

column.name: MedicationNum
column.summary: FK to medication.MedicationNum.

column.name: PatNote
column.summary: Medication notes specific to this patient.

table.name: mount
table.summary: A mount shows in the images module just like other images in the tree. But it is just a container for images within it rather than an actual image itself.

column.name: MountNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: PatNum
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum

column.name: DocCategory
column.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. Categories for documents.

column.name: DateCreated
column.summary: The date at which the mount itself was created. Has no bearing on the creation date of the images the mount houses.

column.name: Description
column.summary: Used to provide a document description in the image module tree-view.

column.name: ImgType
column.summary: Enum:ImageType This is so that an image can be properly associated with the mount in the image module tree-view.

Enumeration.name: ImageType
Enumeration.summary: The type of image for images module.
Enumeration.EnumValue: 3- For instance a Word document or a spreadsheet. Not an image.

column.name: Note
column.summary: To allow the user to enter specific information regarding the exam and tooth numbers, as well as points on interest in the xray images.

column.name: Width
column.summary: The static width of the mount, in pixels.

column.name: Height
column.summary: The static height of the mount, in pixels.

table.name: mountdef
table.summary: THIS TABLE IS NOT BEING USED. These can be freely deleted, renamed, moved, etc. without affecting any patient info. mountitemdef

column.name: MountDefNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: ItemOrder
column.summary: The order that the mount defs will show in various lists.

column.name: IsRadiograph
column.summary: Set to true if this is just xrays. If true, this prevents image from being scaled to fit inside the mount. If false (composite photographs for example) then the images will be scaled to fit inside the mount. Later, the basic appearance or background color might be set based on this flag as well.

column.name: Width
column.summary: The width of the mount, in pixels. For radiograph mounts, this could be very large. It must be large enough for the radiographs to fit in the mount without scaling. For photos, it should also be large so that the scaling won't be too noticeable. Shrinking to view or print will always produce nicer results than enlarging to view or print.

column.name: Height
column.summary: Height of the mount in pixels.

table.name: mountitem
table.summary: These are always attached to a mount and are constant. Should not be deleted, but rather updated if geometry changes.

column.name: MountItemNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: MountNum
column.summary: FK to mount.MountNum.

column.name: Xpos
column.summary: The x position, in pixels, of the item on the mount.

column.name: Ypos
column.summary: The y position, in pixels, of the item on the mount.

column.name: OrdinalPos
column.summary: The ordinal position of the item on the mount.

column.name: Width
column.summary: The scaled or unscaled width of the mount item in pixels.

column.name: Height
column.summary: The scaled or unscaled height of the mount item in pixels.

table.name: mountitemdef
table.summary: THIS TABLE IS NOT BEING USED. These are always attached to mountdefs. Can be deleted without any problems.

column.name: MountItemDefNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: MountDefNum
column.summary: FK to mountdef.MountDefNum.

column.name: Xpos
column.summary: The x position, in pixels, of the item on the mount.

column.name: Ypos
column.summary: The y position, in pixels, of the item on the mount.

column.name: Width
column.summary: Ignored if mount IsRadiograph. For other mounts, the image will be scaled to fit within this space. Any cropping, rotating, etc, will all be defined in the original image itself.

column.name: Height
column.summary: Ignored if mount IsRadiograph. For other mounts, the image will be scaled to fit within this space. Any cropping, rotating, etc, will all be defined in the original image itself.

table.name: operatory
table.summary: Each row is a single operatory or column in the appts module.

column.name: OperatoryNum
column.summary: Primary key

column.name: OpName
column.summary: The full name to show in the column.

column.name: Abbrev
column.summary: 5 char or less. Not used much.

column.name: ItemOrder
column.summary: The order that this op column will show. Changing views only hides some ops; it does not change their order.

column.name: IsHidden
column.summary: Used instead of deleting to hide an op that is no longer used.

column.name: ProvDentist
column.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum. The dentist assigned to this op. If more than one dentist might be assigned to an op, then create a second op and use one for each dentist. If 0, then no dentist is assigned.

column.name: ProvHygienist
column.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum. The hygienist assigned to this op. If 0, then no hygienist is assigned.

column.name: IsHygiene
column.summary: Set true if this is a hygiene operatory. The hygienist will then be considered the main provider for this op.

column.name: ClinicNum
column.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. 0 if no clinic.

table.name: orionproc
table.summary: This table is only used by one customer. 1:1 relationship to procedurelog table.

column.name: OrionProcNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: ProcNum
column.summary: FK to procedurelog.ProcNum

Enumeration.name: OrionDPC
Enumeration.EnumValue: 2- Treatment to be scheduled within 1 calendar day
3- Treatment to be scheduled within 30 calendar days
4- Treatment to be scheduled within 60 calendar days
5– Treatment to be scheduled within 120 calendar days
6– Treatment to be scheduled within 1 year
7– No further treatment is needed, no appointment needed

column.name: DateScheduleBy
column.summary: System adds days to the diagnosis date based upon the DPC entered for that procedure. If DPC = none the system will return “No Schedule by Date”.

column.name: DateStopClock
column.summary: Default to current date. Provider shall have to ability to edit with a previous date, but not a future date.

column.name: Status2
column.summary: Enum:OrionStatus None=0,TP=1,C=2,E=4,R=8,RO=16,CS=32,CR=64,CA-Tx=128,CA-ERPD=256,CA-P/D=512,S=1024,ST=2048,W=4096

Enumeration.name: OrionStatus
Enumeration.EnumValue: 0- None. While a normal orion proc would never have this status2, it is still needed for flags in ChartViews. And it's also possible that a status2 slipped through the cracks and was not assigned, leaving it with this value.

column.name: IsEffectiveComm
column.summary: Indicates in the clinical note that effective communication was used for this encounter.

table.name: patfield
table.summary: These are custom fields added and managed by the user.

column.name: PatFieldNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: PatNum
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum

column.name: FieldName
column.summary: FK to patfielddef.FieldName. The full name is shown here for ease of use when running queries. But the user is only allowed to change fieldNames in the patFieldDef setup window.

column.name: FieldValue
column.summary: Any text that the user types in.

table.name: patfielddef
table.summary: These are the definitions for the custom patient fields added and managed by the user.

column.name: PatFieldDefNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: FieldName
column.summary: The name of the field that the user will be allowed to fill in the patient info window.

column.name: FieldType
column.summary: Enum:PatFieldType Text=0,PickList=1,Date=2

column.name: PickList
column.summary: The text that contains pick list values.

table.name: patient
table.summary: One row for each patient. Includes deleted patients.

column.name: PatNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: LName
column.summary: Last name.

column.name: FName
column.summary: First name.

column.name: MiddleI
column.summary: Middle initial or name.

column.name: Preferred
column.summary: Preferred name, aka nickname.

column.name: PatStatus
column.summary: Enum:PatientStatus

column.name: Gender
column.summary: Enum:PatientGender

Enumeration.name: PatientGender
Enumeration.EnumValue: 2- This is not a joke. Required by HIPAA for privacy.

column.name: Position
column.summary: Enum:PatientPosition Marital status would probably be a better name for this column.

column.name: Birthdate
column.summary: Age is not stored in the database. Age is always calculated as needed from birthdate.

column.name: SSN
column.summary: In the US, this is 9 digits, no dashes. For all other countries, any punctuation or format is allowed.

column.name: Address2
column.summary: Optional second address line.

column.name: State
column.summary: 2 Char in USA

column.name: Zip
column.summary: Postal code. For Canadian claims, it must be ANANAN. No validation gets done except there.

column.name: HmPhone
column.summary: Home phone. Includes any punctuation

column.name: Guarantor
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. Head of household.

column.name: CreditType
column.summary: Single char. Shows at upper right corner of appointments. Suggested use is A,B,or C to designate creditworthiness, but it can actually be used for any purpose.

column.name: Salutation
column.summary: Dear __. This field does not include the "Dear" or a trailing comma. If this field is blank, then the typical salutation is FName. Or, if a Preferred name is present, that is used instead of FName.

column.name: EstBalance
column.summary: Current patient balance.(not family). Never subtracts insurance estimates.

column.name: PriProv
column.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum. The patient's primary provider. Required. The database maintenance tool ensures that every patient always has this number set, so the program no longer has to handle 0.

column.name: SecProv
column.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum. Secondary provider (hygienist). Optional.

column.name: FeeSched
column.summary: FK to feesched.FeeSchedNum. Fee schedule for this patient. Usually not used. If missing, the practice default fee schedule is used. If patient has insurance, then the fee schedule for the insplan is used.

column.name: BillingType
column.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. Must have a value, or the patient will not show on some reports.

column.name: ImageFolder
column.summary: Name of folder where images will be stored. Not editable for now.

column.name: AddrNote
column.summary: Address or phone note. Unlimited length in order to handle data from other programs during a conversion.

column.name: FamFinUrgNote
column.summary: Family financial urgent note. Only stored with guarantor, and shared for family.

column.name: MedUrgNote
column.summary: Individual patient note for Urgent medical.

column.name: ApptModNote
column.summary: Individual patient note for Appointment module note.

column.name: StudentStatus
column.summary: Single char for Nonstudent, Parttime, or Fulltime. Blank also=Nonstudent

column.name: SchoolName
column.summary: College name. If Canadian, then this is field C10 and must be filled if C9 (patient.CanadianEligibilityCode) is 1 and patient is 18 or older.

column.name: ChartNumber
column.summary: Max 15 char. Used for reference to previous programs.

column.name: MedicaidID
column.summary: Optional. The Medicaid ID for this patient.

column.name: Bal_0_30
column.summary: Aged balance from 0 to 30 days old. Aging numbers are for entire family. Only stored with guarantor.

column.name: Bal_31_60
column.summary: Aged balance from 31 to 60 days old. Aging numbers are for entire family. Only stored with guarantor.

column.name: Bal_61_90
column.summary: Aged balance from 61 to 90 days old. Aging numbers are for entire family. Only stored with guarantor.

column.name: BalOver90
column.summary: Aged balance over 90 days old. Aging numbers are for entire family. Only stored with guarantor.

column.name: InsEst
column.summary: Insurance Estimate for entire family.

column.name: BalTotal
column.summary: Total balance for entire family before insurance estimate. Not the same as the sum of the 4 aging balances because this can be negative. Only stored with guarantor.

column.name: EmployerNum
column.summary: FK to employer.EmployerNum.

column.name: EmploymentNote
column.summary: Not used since version 2.8.

column.name: Race
column.summary: Enum:PatientRace Race and ethnicity.

Enumeration.name: PatientRace
Enumeration.summary: Race and ethnicity for patient. Used by public health.

column.name: County
column.summary: FK to county.CountyName, although it will not crash if key absent.

column.name: GradeLevel
column.summary: Enum:PatientGrade Gradelevel.

Enumeration.name: PatientGrade
Enumeration.summary: Grade level used in public health.

column.name: Urgency
column.summary: Enum:TreatmentUrgency Used in public health screenings.

Enumeration.name: TreatmentUrgency
Enumeration.summary: For public health. Unknown, NoProblems, NeedsCarE, or Urgent.

column.name: DateFirstVisit
column.summary: The date that the patient first visited the office. Automated.

column.name: ClinicNum
column.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. Can be zero if not attached to a clinic or no clinics set up.

column.name: HasIns
column.summary: For now, an 'I' indicates that the patient has insurance. This is only used when displaying appointments. It will later be expanded. User can't edit.

column.name: TrophyFolder
column.summary: The Trophy bridge is inadequate. This is an attempt to make it usable for offices that have already invested in Trophy hardware.

column.name: PlannedIsDone
column.summary: This simply indicates whether the 'done' box is checked in the chart module. Used to be handled as a -1 in the NextAptNum field, but now that field is unsigned.

column.name: Premed
column.summary: Set to true if patient needs to be premedicated for appointments, includes PAC, halcion, etc.

column.name: Ward
column.summary: Only used in hospitals.

column.name: PreferConfirmMethod
column.summary: Enum:ContactMethod

column.name: PreferContactMethod
column.summary: Enum:ContactMethod

column.name: PreferRecallMethod
column.summary: Enum:ContactMethod

column.name: SchedBeforeTime
column.summary: Only the time portion of the TimeSpan is used.

column.name: SchedDayOfWeek
column.summary: We do not use this, but some users do, so here it is. 0=none. Otherwise, 1-7 for day.

column.name: Language
column.summary: The primary language of the patient. Typically en, fr, es, or similar. We might later also allow cultures and user-defined languages.

column.name: AdmitDate
column.summary: Used in hospitals. It can be before the first visit date. It typically gets set automatically by the hospital system.

column.name: Title
column.summary: Includes any punctuation. For example, Mr., Mrs., Miss, Dr., etc. There is no selection mechanism yet for user; they must simply type it in.

column.name: SiteNum
column.summary: FK to site.SiteNum. Can be zero. Replaces the old GradeSchool field with a proper foreign key.

column.name: DateTStamp
column.summary: The last date and time this row was altered. Not user editable.

column.name: ResponsParty
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. Can be zero. Person responsible for medical decisions rather than finances. Guarantor is still responsible for finances. This is useful for nursing home residents. Part of public health.

column.name: CanadianEligibilityCode
column.summary: C09. Eligibility Exception Code. A single digit 1-4. 0 is not acceptable for e-claims. 1=FT student, 2=disabled, 3=disabled student, 4=code not applicable. Warning. 4 is a 0 if using CDAnet version 02.

column.name: AskToArriveEarly
column.summary: Number of minutes patient is asked to come early to appointments.

table.name: patientnote
table.summary: Essentially more columns in the patient table. They are stored here because these fields can contain a lot of information, and we want to try to keep the size of the patient table a bit smaller.

column.name: PatNum
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. Also the primary key for this table. Always one to one relationship with patient table. A new patient might not have an entry here until needed.

column.name: FamFinancial
column.summary: Only one note per family stored with guarantor.

column.name: ApptPhone
column.summary: No longer used.

column.name: Medical
column.summary: Medical Summary

column.name: Service
column.summary: Service notes

column.name: MedicalComp
column.summary: Complete current Medical History

column.name: Treatment
column.summary: Shows in the Chart module just below the graphical tooth chart.

column.name: CCNumber
column.summary: Credit Card Number. It is a field that must be turned on to be visible, so it usually isn't.

column.name: CCExpiration
column.summary: Credit Card expiration date. Only month and year are used, and the day is usually just 1. This field is usually hidden to the user.

table.name: patplan
table.summary: Each row represents the linking of one insplan to one patient for current coverage. Dropping a plan will delete the entry in this table. Deleting a plan will delete the actual insplan (if no dependencies).

column.name: PatPlanNum
column.summary: Primary key

column.name: PatNum
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. The patient who currently has the insurance. Not the same as the subscriber.

column.name: PlanNum
column.summary: FK to insplan.PlanNum. The insurance plan attached to the patient.

column.name: Ordinal
column.summary: Number like 1, 2, 3, etc. Represents primary ins, secondary ins, tertiary ins, etc. 0 is not used

column.name: IsPending
column.summary: For informational purposes only. For now, we lose the previous feature which let us set isPending without entering a plan. Now, you have to enter the plan in order to check this box.

column.name: Relationship
column.summary: Enum:Relat Remember that this may need to be changed in the Claim also, if already created.

Enumeration.name: Relat
Enumeration.summary: Relationship to subscriber for insurance.

column.name: PatID
column.summary: An optional patient ID which will override the insplan.SubscriberID on eclaims. For Canada, this holds the Dependent Code, C17 and E17, and in that use it doesn't override subscriber id, but instead supplements it.

column.name: InsSubNum
column.summary: FK to inssub.InsSubNum. Gives info about the subscriber.

table.name: payment
table.summary: A patient payment. Always has at least one split.

column.name: PayNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: PayType
column.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. This will be 0 if this is an income transfer to another provider.

column.name: PayDate
column.summary: The date the the payment displays on the patient account.

column.name: PayAmt
column.summary: Amount of the payment. Must equal the sum of the splits.

column.name: CheckNum
column.summary: Check number is optional.

column.name: BankBranch
column.summary: Bank-branch for checks.

column.name: PayNote
column.summary: Any admin note. Not for patient to see.

column.name: IsSplit
column.summary: Set to true to indicate that a payment is split. Just makes a few functions easier. Might be eliminated.

column.name: PatNum
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. The patient where the payment entry will show. But only the splits affect account balances. This has a value even if the 'payment' is actually an income transfer to another provider.

column.name: ClinicNum
column.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. Can be 0. Copied from patient.ClinicNum when creating payment, but user can override. Not used in provider income transfers. Cannot be used in financial reporting when grouping by clinic, because payments may be split between clinics.

column.name: DateEntry
column.summary: The date that this payment was entered. Not user editable.

column.name: DepositNum
column.summary: FK to deposit.DepositNum. 0 if not attached to any deposits. Cash does not usually get attached to a deposit; only checks.

table.name: payperiod
table.summary: Used to view employee timecards. Timecard entries are not linked to a pay period. Instead, payperiods are setup, and the user can only view specific pay periods. So it feels like they are linked, but it's date based.

column.name: PayPeriodNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: DateStart
column.summary: The first day of the payperiod

column.name: DateStop
column.summary: The last day of the payperiod.

column.name: DatePaycheck
column.summary: The date that paychecks will be dated. A few days after the dateStop. Optional.

table.name: payplan
table.summary: Each row represents one signed agreement to make payments.

column.name: PayPlanNum
column.summary: Primary key

column.name: PatNum
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. The patient who had the treatment done.

column.name: Guarantor
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. The person responsible for the payments. Does not need to be in the same family as the patient. Will be 0 if planNum has a value.

column.name: PayPlanDate
column.summary: Date that the payment plan will display in the account.

column.name: APR
column.summary: Annual percentage rate. eg 18. This does not take into consideration any late payments, but only the percentage used to calculate the amortization schedule.

column.name: Note
column.summary: Generally used to archive the terms when the amortization schedule is created.

column.name: PlanNum
column.summary: FK to insplan.PlanNum. Will be 0 if standard payment plan. But if this is being used to track expected insurance payments, then this will be the foreign key to insplan.PlanNum and Guarantor will be 0.

column.name: CompletedAmt
column.summary: The amount of the treatment that has already been completed. This should match the sum of the principal amounts for most situations. But if the procedures have not yet been completed, and the payment plan is to make any sense, then this number must be changed.

column.name: InsSubNum
column.summary: FK to inssub.InsSubNum.

table.name: payplancharge
table.summary: One of the dated charges attached to a payment plan. This has nothing to do with payments, but rather just causes the amount due to increase on the date of the charge. The amount of the charge is the sum of the principal and the interest.

column.name: PayPlanChargeNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: PayPlanNum
column.summary: FK to payplan.PayPlanNum.

column.name: Guarantor
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. The guarantor account that each charge will affect.

column.name: PatNum
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. The patient account that the principal gets removed from.

column.name: ChargeDate
column.summary: The date that the charge will show on the patient account. Any charge with a future date will not show on the account yet and will not affect the balance.

column.name: Principal
column.summary: The principal portion of this payment.

column.name: Interest
column.summary: The interest portion of this payment.

column.name: Note
column.summary: Any note about this particular payment plan charge

column.name: ProvNum
column.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum. Since there is no ProvNum field at the payplan level, the provider must be the same for all payplancharges. It's initially assigned as the patient priProv. Payments applied should be to this provnum, although the current user interface does not help with this.

column.name: ClinicNum
column.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. Since there is no ClincNum field at the payplan level, the clinic must be the same for all payplancharges. It's initially assigned using the patient clinic. Payments applied should be to this clinic, although the current user interface does not help with this.

table.name: paysplit
table.summary: Always attached to a payment. Always affects exactly one patient account and one provider.

column.name: SplitNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: SplitAmt
column.summary: Amount of split.

column.name: PatNum
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

column.name: ProcDate
column.summary: Procedure date. Typically only used if tied to a procedure. In older versions (before 7.0), this was the date that showed on the account. Frequently the same as the date of the payment, but not necessarily. Not when the payment was made. This is what the aging will be based on in a future version.

column.name: PayNum
column.summary: FK to payment.PayNum. Every paysplit must be linked to a payment.

column.name: IsDiscount
column.summary: No longer used.

column.name: DiscountType
column.summary: No longer used

column.name: ProvNum
column.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

column.name: PayPlanNum
column.summary: FK to payplan.PayPlanNum. 0 if not attached to a payplan.

column.name: DatePay
column.summary: Date always in perfect synch with Payment date.

column.name: ProcNum
column.summary: FK to procedurelog.ProcNum. 0 if not attached to a procedure.

column.name: DateEntry
column.summary: Date this paysplit was created. User not allowed to edit.

column.name: UnearnedType
column.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. Usually 0 unless this is a special unearned split.

column.name: ClinicNum
column.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. Can be 0. Need not match the ClinicNum of the Payment, because a payment can be split between clinics.

table.name: perioexam
table.summary: One perio exam for one patient on one date. Has lots of periomeasures attached to it.

column.name: PerioExamNum

Enumeration.EnumValue: 3-MucoGingivalJunction- the division between attached and unattached mucosa.
5-For the skiptooth type, set surf to none, and ToothValue to 1.
6. Sum of flags for bleeding(1), suppuration(2), plaque(4), and calculus(8).
7. But this type is never saved to the db. It is always calculated on the fly.

column.name: ToothValue

In phoneTrackingServer initialize, this value is pulled from employee.ClockStatus as Home, Lunch, Break, or Working(which gets converted to Available). After that, the phone server uses those 4 in addition to WrapUp, Off, Training, TeamAssist, OfflineAssist, Backup, and None(which is displayed as an empty string). The main program sets Unavailable sometimes, and pulls from employee.ClockStatus sometimes.

column.name: SigIsTopaz
column.summary: There are two kinds of signatures. Topaz signatures use hardware manufactured by that company, and the signature is created by their library. OD signatures work exactly the same way, but are only for on-screen signing.

column.name: Signature
column.summary: The encrypted signature. A signature starts as a collection of vectors. The Topaz .sig file format is proprietary. The OD signature format looks like this: 45,68;48,70;49,72;0,0;55,88;etc. It's simply a sequence of points, separated by semicolons. 0,0 represents pen up. Then, a hash is created from the Note, concatenated directly with the userNum. For example, "This is a note3" gets turned into a hash of 2849283940385391 (16 bytes). The hash is used to encrypt the signature data string using symmetric encryption. Therefore, the actual signature cannot be retrieved from the database by ordinary means. Also, the signature info cannot even be retrieved by Open Dental at all unless it supplies the same hash as before, proving that the data has not changed since signed. If OD supplies the correct hash, then it will be able to extract the sequence of vectors which it will then use to display the signature. The OD sigs are not compressed, and the Topaz sigs are. But there is very little difference in their sizes. It would be very rare for a signature to be larger than 1000 bytes.

table.name: recall
table.summary:
Max one per patient. A patient can only have one recall date set for each type (there is currently only one type). The recall table stores a few dates that must be kept synchronized with other information in the database. This is difficult. Anytime one of the following items changes, things need to be synchronized: procedurecode.SetRecall, any procedurelog change for a patient (procs added, deleted, completed, status changed, date changed, etc), patient status changed. There are expected to be a few bugs in the synchronization logic, so anytime a patient's recall is opened, it will also update.
During synchronization, the program will frequently alter DateDueCalc, DateDue, and DatePrevious based on trigger procs. The system will also add and delete recalls as necessary. But it will not delete a recall unless all values are default and there is no useful information. When a user tries to delete a recall, they will only be successful if the trigger conditions do not apply. Otherwise, they will have to disable the recall instead.

column.name: RecallNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: PatNum
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

column.name: DateDueCalc
column.summary: Not editable. The calculated date due. Generated by the program and subject to change anytime the conditions change. It can be blank (0001-01-01) if no appropriate triggers.

column.name: DateDue
column.summary: This is the date that is actually used when doing reports for recall. It will usually be the same as DateDueCalc unless user has changed it. System will only update this field if it is the same as DateDueCalc. Otherwise, it will be left alone. Gets cleared along with DateDueCalc when resetting recall. When setting disabled, this field will also be cleared. This is the field to use if converting from another software.

column.name: DatePrevious
column.summary: Not editable. Previous date that procedures were done to trigger this recall. It is calculated and enforced automatically. If you want to affect this date, add a procedure to the chart with a status of C, EC, or EO.

column.name: RecallInterval
column.summary: The interval between recalls. The Interval struct combines years, months, weeks, and days into a single integer value.

column.name: RecallStatus
column.summary: FK to definition.DefNum, or 0 for none.

column.name: Note
column.summary: An administrative note for staff use.

column.name: IsDisabled
column.summary: If true, this recall type will be disabled (there's only one type right now). This is usually used rather than deleting the recall type from the patient because the program must enforce the trigger conditions for all patients.

column.name: RecallTypeNum
column.summary: FK to recalltype.RecallTypeNum.

column.name: DisableUntilBalance
column.summary: Default is 0. If a positive number is entered, then the family balance must be less in order for this recall to show in the recall list.

column.name: DisableUntilDate
column.summary: If a date is entered, then this recall will be disabled until that date.

table.summary: Links one procedurecode to one recalltype. The presence of this trigger is used when determining DatePrevious in the recall table.

table.name: sheetfield
table.summary: One field on a sheet.

column.name: SheetFieldNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: SheetNum
column.summary: FK to sheet.SheetNum.

column.name: FieldType
column.summary: Enum:SheetFieldType OutputText, InputField, StaticText,Parameter(only used for SheetField, not SheetFieldDef),Image,Drawing,Line,Rectangle,CheckBox,SigBox,PatImage.

column.name: FieldName
column.summary: Mostly for OutputText and InputField types. Each sheet typically has a main datatable type. For OutputText types, FieldName is usually the string representation of the database column for the main table. For other tables, it can be of the form table.Column. There may also be extra fields available that are not strictly pulled from the database. Extra fields will start with lowercase to indicate that they are not pure database fields. The list of available fields for each type in SheetFieldsAvailable. Users can pick from that list. Likewise, InputField types are internally tied to actions to persist the data. So they are also hard coded and are available in SheetFieldsAvailable. For static images, this is the full file name including extension, but without path. Static images paths are reconstructed by looking in the AtoZ folder, SheetImages folder. For a PatImage, this now contains the long FK to the document. A join must be done to that table to find the filename. When a SheetField has a fieldType of Parameter, then the FieldName stores the name of the parameter.

column.name: FieldValue
column.summary: For OutputText, this value is set before printing. This is the data obtained from the database and ready to print. For StaticText, this is copied from the sheetFieldDef, but in-line fields like [this] will have been filled. For an archived sheet retrieved from the database (all SheetField rows), this value will have been saved and will not be filled again automatically. For a parameter fieldtype, this will store the value of the parameter. For a Drawing fieldtype, this will be the point data for the lines. The format would look similar to this: 45,68;48,70;49,72;0,0;55,88;etc. It's simply a sequence of points, separated by semicolons. For CheckBox, it will either be an X or empty. For SigBox, the first char will be 0 or 1 to indicate SigIsTopaz, and all subsequent chars will be the Signature itself. For Pat Image, this contains image size and image position info. Like this: "X=0,Y=20,W=100,H=60". This is initially generated automatically to fit the object. It can later be changed by the user to "zoom and pan" within the confines of the object.

column.name: FontSize
column.summary: The fontSize for this field regardless of the default for the sheet. The actual font must be saved with each sheetField.

column.name: FontName
column.summary: The fontName for this field regardless of the default for the sheet. The actual font must be saved with each sheetField.

column.name: XPos
column.summary: In pixels.

column.name: YPos
column.summary: In pixels.

column.name: Width
column.summary: The field will be constrained horizontally to this size. Not allowed to be zero.

column.name: Height
column.summary: The field will be constrained vertically to this size. Not allowed to be 0. It's not allowed to be zero so that it will be visible on the designer.

column.name: GrowthBehavior
column.summary: Enum:GrowthBehaviorEnum

Enumeration.name: GrowthBehaviorEnum
Enumeration.summary: For sheetFields
Enumeration.EnumValue: Not allowed to grow. Max size would be Height and Width.
Can grow down if needed, and will push nearby objects out of the way so that there is no overlap.
Can grow down, and will push down all objects on the sheet that are below it. Mostly used when drawing grids.

column.name: RadioButtonValue
column.summary: This is only used for checkboxes that you want to behave like radiobuttons. Set the FieldName the same for each Checkbox in the group. The FieldValue will likely be X for one of them and empty string for the others. Each of them will have a different RadioButtonValue. Whichever box has X, the RadioButtonValue for that box will be used when importing. This field is not used for "misc" radiobutton groups.

column.name: RadioButtonGroup
column.summary: Name which identifies the group within which the radio button belongs. FieldName must be set to "misc" in order for the group to take effect.

column.name: IsRequired
column.summary: Set to true if this field is required to have a value before the sheet is closed.

table.name: sheetfielddef
table.summary: One field on a sheetDef.

column.name: SheetFieldDefNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: SheetDefNum
column.summary: FK to sheetdef.SheetDefNum.

column.name: FieldType
column.summary: Enum:SheetFieldType OutputText, InputField, StaticText,Parameter(only used for SheetField, not SheetFieldDef),Image,Drawing,Line,Rectangle,CheckBox,SigBox,PatImage.

column.name: FieldName
column.summary: Mostly for OutputText, InputField, and CheckBox types. Each sheet typically has a main datatable type. For OutputText types, FieldName is usually the string representation of the database column for the main table. For other tables, it can be of the form table.Column. There may also be extra fields available that are not strictly pulled from the database. Extra fields will start with lowercase to indicate that they are not pure database fields. The list of available fields for each type in SheetFieldsAvailable. Users can pick from that list. Likewise, InputField types are internally tied to actions to persist the data. So they are also hard coded and are available in SheetFieldsAvailable. For static images, this is the full file name including extension, but without path. Static images paths are reconstructed by looking in the AtoZ folder, SheetImages folder. For Pat Images, this is an long FK/DefNum to the default folder for the image. The filename of a PatImage will later be stored in FieldValue.

column.name: FieldValue
column.summary: For StaticText, this text can include bracketed fields, like [nameLF]. For OutputText and InputField, this will be blank. For CheckBoxes, either X or blank. Even if the checkbox is set to behave like a radio button.

column.name: FontSize
column.summary: The fontSize for this field regardless of the default for the sheet. The actual font must be saved with each sheetField.

column.name: FontName
column.summary: The fontName for this field regardless of the default for the sheet. The actual font must be saved with each sheetField.

column.name: XPos
column.summary: In pixels.

column.name: YPos
column.summary: In pixels.

column.name: Width
column.summary: The field will be constrained horizontally to this size. Not allowed to be zero.

column.name: Height
column.summary: The field will be constrained vertically to this size. Not allowed to be 0. It's not allowed to be zero so that it will be visible on the designer.

column.name: GrowthBehavior
column.summary: Enum:GrowthBehaviorEnum

Enumeration.name: GrowthBehaviorEnum
Enumeration.summary: For sheetFields
Enumeration.EnumValue: Not allowed to grow. Max size would be Height and Width.
Can grow down if needed, and will push nearby objects out of the way so that there is no overlap.
Can grow down, and will push down all objects on the sheet that are below it. Mostly used when drawing grids.

column.name: RadioButtonValue
column.summary: This is only used for checkboxes that you want to behave like radiobuttons. Set the FieldName the same for each Checkbox in the group. The FieldValue will likely be X for one of them and empty string for the others. Each of them will have a different RadioButtonValue. Whichever box has X, the RadioButtonValue for that box will be used when importing. This field is not used for "misc" radiobutton groups.

column.name: RadioButtonGroup
column.summary: Name which identifies the group within which the radio button belongs. FieldName must be set to "misc" in order for the group to take effect.

column.name: IsRequired
column.summary: Set to true if this field is required to have a value before the sheet is closed.

table.name: sigbutdef
table.summary: This defines the light buttons on the left of the main screen.

column.name: SigButDefNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: ButtonText
column.summary: The text on the button

column.name: ButtonIndex
column.summary: 0-based index defines the order of the buttons.

column.name: SynchIcon
column.summary: 0=none, or 1-9. The cell in the 3x3 tic-tac-toe main program icon that is to be synched with this button. It will light up or clear whenever this button lights or clears.

column.name: ComputerName
column.summary: Blank for the default buttons. Or contains the computer name for the buttons that override the defaults.

table.name: sigbutdefelement
table.summary: This table stores references to the sequence of sounds and lights that should get sent out with a button push.

column.name: ElementNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: SigButDefNum
column.summary: FK to sigbutdef.SigButDefNum A few elements are usually attached to a single button.

column.name: SigElementDefNum
column.summary: FK to sigelementdef.SigElementDefNum, which contains the actual sound or light.

table.name: sigelement
table.summary: These are the actual elements attached to each signal that is sent. They contain references to the sounds and lights that should result.

column.name: SigElementNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: SigElementDefNum
column.summary: FK to sigelementdef.SigElementDefNum

column.name: SignalNum
column.summary: FK to signal.SignalNum.

table.name: sigelementdef
table.summary: This defines the items that will be available for clicking when composing a manual message. Also, these are referred to in the button definitions as a sequence of elements.

column.name: SigElementDefNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: LightRow
column.summary: If this element should cause a button to light up, this would be the row. 0 means none.

column.name: LightColor
column.summary: If a light row is set, this is the color it will turn when triggered. Ack sets it back to white. Note that color and row can be in two separate elements of the same signal.

column.name: SigElementType
column.summary: Enum:SignalElementType 0=User,1=Extra,2=Message.

Enumeration.name: SignalElementType
Enumeration.summary: 0=User,1=Extra,2=Message.
Enumeration.EnumValue: 0-To and From lists. Not tied in any way to the users that are part of security.
Typically used to insert "family" before "phone" signals.
Elements of this type show in the last column and trigger the message to be sent.

column.name: SigText
column.summary: The text that shows for the element, like the user name or the two word message. No long text is stored here.

column.name: Sound
column.summary: The sound to play for this element. Wav file stored in the database in string format until "played". If empty string, then no sound.

column.name: ItemOrder
column.summary: The order of this element within the list of the same type.

table.name: signal
table.summary: An actual signal that gets sent out as part of the messaging functionality.

column.name: SignalNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: FromUser
column.summary: Text version of 'user' this message was sent from, which can actually be any description of a group or individual.

column.name: ITypes
column.summary: Enum:InvalidType List of InvalidType long values separated by commas. Can be empty. When Date or Tasks are used, they are used all alone with no other flags present.

Enumeration.name: InvalidType
Enumeration.summary: When the autorefresh message is sent to the other computers, this is the type.
Enumeration.EnumValue: 1 Not used with any other flags
2 Deprecated. Inefficient. All flags combined except Date and Tasks.
3 Not used with any other flags. Used to just indicate added tasks, but now it indicates any change at all except those where a popup is needed. If we also want a popup, then use TaskPopup.
34. This is used internally by OD, Inc with the phonenumber table and the phone server.
50. This is used internally by OD, Inc with the phone server to trigger the phone system to reload after changing which call groups users are in.

column.name: DateViewing
column.summary: If IType=Date, then this is the affected date in the Appointments module.

column.name: SigType
column.summary: Enum:SignalType Button, or Invalid.

Enumeration.name: SignalType
Enumeration.summary: The type of signal being sent.

column.name: SigText
column.summary: This is only used if the type is button, and the user types in some text. This is the typed portion and does not include any of the text that was on the buttons. These types of signals are displayed in their own separate list in addition to any light and sound that they may cause.

column.name: SigDateTime
column.summary: The exact server time when this signal was entered into db. This does not need to be set by sender since it's handled automatically.

column.name: ToUser
column.summary: Text version of 'user' this message was sent to, which can actually be any description of a group or individual.

column.name: AckTime
column.summary: If this signal has been acknowledged, then this will contain the date and time. This is how lights get turned off also.

column.name: TaskNum
column.summary: FK to task.TaskNum. If IType=Tasks, then this is the taskNum that was added.

table.name: site
table.summary: Generally used by mobile clinics to track the temporary locations where treatment is performed, such as schools, nursing homes, and community centers. Replaces the old school table.

column.name: SiteNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: Note
column.summary: Notes could include phone, address, contacts, etc.

table.name: statement
table.summary: Represents one statement for one family. Usually already sent, but could still be waiting to send.

column.name: StatementNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: PatNum
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. Typically the guarantor. Can also be the patient for walkout statements.

column.name: DateSent
column.summary: This will always be a valid and reasonable date regardless of whether it's actually been sent yet.

column.name: DateRangeFrom
column.summary: Typically 45 days before dateSent

column.name: DateRangeTo
column.summary: Any date >= year 2200 is considered max val. We generally try to automate this value to be the same date as the statement rather than the max val. This is so that when payment plans are displayed, we can add approximately 10 days to effectively show the charge that will soon be due. Adding the 10 days is not done until display time.

column.name: Note
column.summary: Can include line breaks. This ordinary note will be in the standard font.

column.name: NoteBold
column.summary: More important notes may go here. Font will be bold. Color and size of text will be customizable in setup.

column.name: Mode_
column.summary: Enum:StatementMode Mail, InPerson, Email, Electronic.

column.name: HidePayment
column.summary: Set true to hide the credit card section, and the please pay box.

column.name: SinglePatient
column.summary: One patient on statement instead of entire family.

column.name: Intermingled
column.summary: If entire family, then this determines whether they are all intermingled into one big grid, or whether they are all listed in separate grids.

column.name: IsSent
column.summary: True

column.name: DocNum
column.summary: FK to document.DocNum when a pdf has been archived.

table.name: supplier
table.summary: A company that provides supplies for the office, typically dental supplies.

column.name: SupplierNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: CustomerId
column.summary: The customer ID that this office uses for transactions with the supplier

column.name: Website
column.summary: Full address to website. We might make it clickable.

column.name: UserName
column.summary: The username used to log in to the supplier website.

column.name: Password
column.summary: The password to log in to the supplier website. Not encrypted or hidden in any way.

column.name: Note
column.summary: Any note regarding supplier. Could hold address, CC info, etc.

table.name: supply
table.summary: A dental supply or office supply item.

column.name: SupplyNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: SupplierNum
column.summary: FK to supplier.SupplierNum

column.name: CatalogNumber
column.summary: The catalog item number that the supplier uses to identify the supply.

column.name: Descript
column.summary: The description can be similar to the catalog, but not required. Typically includes qty per box/case, etc.

column.name: Category
column.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. User can define their own categories for supplies.

column.name: ItemOrder
column.summary: The zero-based order of this supply within it's category.

column.name: LevelDesired
column.summary: The level that a fresh order should bring item back up to. Can include fractions. If this is 0, then it will be displayed as having this field blank rather than showing 0. This simply gives a cleaner look.

column.name: IsHidden
column.summary: If hidden, then this supply item won't normally show in the main list.

column.name: Price
column.summary: The price per unit that the supplier charges for this supply. If this is 0.00, then no price will be displayed.

column.name: SupplyNeededNum
column.summary: Primary key.

table.name: supplyorder
table.summary: One supply order to one supplier. Contains SupplyOrderItems.

column.name: SupplyOrderNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: SupplierNum
column.summary: FK to supplier.SupplierNum.

column.name: DatePlaced
column.summary: A date greater than 2200 (eg 2500), is considered a max date. A max date is used for an order that was started but has not yet been placed. This puts it at the end of the list where it belongs, but it will display as blank. Only one unplaced order is allowed per supplier.

column.name: AmountTotal
column.summary: The sum of all the amounts of each item on the order. If any of the item prices are zero, then it won't auto calculate this total. This will allow the user to manually put in the total without having it get deleted.

table.name: supplyorderitem
table.summary: One item on one supply order. This table links supplies to orders as well as storing a small amount of additional info.

column.name: SupplyOrderItemNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: SupplyOrderNum
column.summary: FK to supplyorder.supplyOrderNum.

column.name: SupplyNum
column.summary: FK to supply.SupplyNum.

column.name: Qty
column.summary: How many were ordered.

column.name: Price
column.summary: Price per unit on this order.

table.name: task
table.summary: A task is a single todo item.

column.name: TaskNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: TaskListNum
column.summary: FK to tasklist.TaskListNum. If 0, then it will show in the trunk of a section.

column.name: DateTask
column.summary: Only used if this task is assigned to a dated category. Children are NOT dated. Only dated if they should show in the trunk for a date category. They can also have a parent if they are in the main list as well.

column.name: KeyNum
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum or appointment.AptNum. Only used when ObjectType is not 0.

column.name: Descript
column.summary: The description of this task. Might be very long.

column.name: TaskStatus
column.summary: Enum:TaskStatusEnum New,Viewed,Done.

column.name: IsRepeating
column.summary: True if it is to show in the repeating section. There should be no date. All children and parents should also be set to IsRepeating=true.

column.name: DateType
column.summary: Enum:TaskDateType None, Day, Week, Month. If IsRepeating, then setting to None effectively disables the repeating feature.

column.name: FromNum
column.summary: FK to task.TaskNum If this is derived from a repeating task, then this will hold the TaskNum of that task. It helps automate the adding and deleting of tasks. It might be deleted automatically if not are marked complete.

column.name: ObjectType
column.summary: Enum:TaskObjectType 0=none,1=Patient,2=Appointment. More will be added later. If a type is selected, then the KeyNum will contain the primary key of the corresponding Patient or Appointment. Does not really have anything to do with the ObjectType of the parent tasklist, although they tend to match.

Enumeration.name: TaskObjectType
Enumeration.summary: Used when attaching objects to tasks. These are the choices.

column.name: DateTimeEntry
column.summary: The date and time that this task was added. Used to sort the list by the order entered.

column.name: UserNum
column.summary: FK to user.UserNum. The person who created the task or who made the most recent edit to the task.

column.name: DateTimeFinished
column.summary: The date and time that this task was marked "done".

table.name: taskancestor
table.summary: Represents one ancestor of one task. Each task will have at least one ancestor unless it is directly on a main trunk. An ancestor is defined as a tasklist that is higher in the heirarchy for the task, regardless of how many levels up it is. This allows us to mark task lists as having "new" tasks, and it allows us to quickly check for new tasks for a user on startup.

column.name: TaskAncestorNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: TaskNum
column.summary: FK to task.TaskNum

column.name: TaskListNum
column.summary: FK to tasklist.TaskListNum

table.name: tasklist
table.summary: A tasklist is like a folder system, where it can have child tasklists as well as tasks.

column.name: TaskListNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: Descript
column.summary: The description of this tasklist. Might be very long, but not usually.

column.name: Parent
column.summary: FK to tasklist.TaskListNum The parent task list to which this task list is assigned. If zero, then this task list is on the main trunk of one of the sections.

column.name: DateTL
column.summary: Optional. Set to 0001-01-01 for no date. If a date is assigned, then this list will also be available from the date section.

column.name: IsRepeating
column.summary: True if it is to show in the repeating section. There should be no date. All children should also be set to IsRepeating=true.

column.name: DateType
column.summary: Enum:TaskDateType None, Day, Week, Month. If IsRepeating, then setting to None effectively disables the repeating feature.

column.name: FromNum
column.summary: FK to tasklist.TaskListNum If this is derived from a repeating list, then this will hold the TaskListNum of that list. It helps automate the adding and deleting of lists. It might be deleted automatically if no tasks are marked complete.

column.name: ObjectType
column.summary: Enum:TaskObjectType 0=none, 1=Patient, 2=Appointment. More will be added later. If a type is selected, then this list will be visible in the appropriate places for attaching the correct type of object. The type is not copied to a task when created. Tasks in this list do not have to be of the same type. You can only attach an object to a task, not a tasklist.

Enumeration.name: TaskObjectType
Enumeration.summary: Used when attaching objects to tasks. These are the choices.

column.name: DateTimeEntry
column.summary: The date and time that this list was added. Used to sort the list by the order entered.

table.name: tasksubscription
table.summary: A subscription of one user to either a tasklist or to a task.

column.name: TaskSubscriptionNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: UserNum
column.summary: FK to userod.UserNum

column.name: TaskListNum
column.summary: FK to tasklist.TaskListNum

column.name: TaskUnreadNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: TaskNum
column.summary: FK to task.TaskNum.

column.name: UserNum
column.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.

table.name: terminalactive
table.summary: Each row is one computer that currently acting as a terminal for new patient info input.

column.name: TerminalActiveNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: ComputerName
column.summary: The name of the computer where the terminal is active.

column.name: TerminalStatus
column.summary: Enum:TerminalStatusEnum No longer used. Instead, the PatNum field is used. Used to indicates at what point the patient was in the sequence. 0=standby, 1=PatientInfo, 2=Medical, 3=UpdateOnly. If status is 1, then nobody else on the network could open the patient edit window for that patient.

Enumeration.name: TerminalStatusEnum
Enumeration.summary: Indicates at what point the patient is in the sequence. 0=standby, 1=PatientInfo, 2=Medical, 3=UpdateOnly.
Enumeration.EnumValue: 3. Only the patient info tab will be visible. This is just to let patient up date their address and phone number.

column.name: PatNum
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. The patient currently showing in the terminal. If 0, then terminal is in standby mode.

table.name: timeadjust
table.summary: Used on employee timecards to make adjustments.

column.name: TimeAdjustNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: EmployeeNum
column.summary: FK to employee.EmployeeNum

column.name: TimeEntry
column.summary: The date and time that this entry will show on timecard.

column.name: RegHours
column.summary: The number of regular hours to adjust timecard by. Can be + or -.

column.name: OTimeHours
column.summary: Overtime hours. Usually +. Automatically combined with a - adj to RegHours. Another option is clockevent.OTimeHours.

column.name: IsAuto
column.summary: Set to true if this adjustment was automatically made by the system. When the calc weekly ot tool is run, these types of adjustments are fair game for deletion. Other adjustments are preserved.

column.name: TimeCardRuleNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: EmployeeNum
column.summary: FK to employee.EmployeeNum. If zero, then this rule applies to all employees.

column.name: OverHoursPerDay
column.summary: Typical example is 8:00. In California, any work after the first 8 hours is overtime.

column.name: AfterTimeOfDay
column.summary: Typical example is 16:00 to indicate that all time worked after 4pm for specific employees is overtime.

table.name: toolbutitem
table.summary: Each row represents one toolbar button to be placed on a toolbar and linked to a program.

column.name: ToolButItemNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: ProgramNum
column.summary: FK to program.ProgramNum.

column.name: ToolBar
column.summary: Enum:ToolBarsAvail The toolbar to show the button on.

Enumeration.name: ToolBarsAvail
Enumeration.EnumValue: 7 Shows in the toolbar at the top that is common to all modules.

column.name: ButtonText
column.summary: The text to show on the toolbar button.

table.name: toothinitial
table.summary: Used to track missing teeth, primary teeth, movements, and drawings.

column.name: ToothInitialNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: PatNum
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum

column.name: ToothNum
column.summary: 1-32 or A-Z. Supernumeraries not supported here yet.

column.name: InitialType
column.summary: Enum:ToothInitialType

Enumeration.name: ToothInitialType
Enumeration.EnumValue: 1 - Also hides the number. This is now also allowed for primary teeth.

2 - Only used with 1-32. "sets" this tooth as a primary tooth. The result is that the primary tooth shows in addition to the perm, and that the letter shows in addition to the number. It also does a Shift0 -12 and some other handy movements. Even if this is set to true, there can be a separate entry for a missing primary tooth; this would be almost equivalent to not even setting the tooth as primary, but would also allow user to select the letter.

column.name: Movement
column.summary: Shift in mm, or rotation / tipping in degrees.

column.name: DrawingSegment
column.summary: Point data for a drawing segment. The format would look similar to this: 45,68;48,70;49,72;0,0;55,88;etc. It's simply a sequence of points, separated by semicolons. Only positive numbers are used. 0,0 is the upper left of the tooth chart at original size. Stored in pixels as originally drawn. If we ever change the tooth chart, we will have to also keep an old version as an alternate to display old drawings.

table.name: transaction
table.summary: Used in the accounting section of the program. Each row is one transaction in the ledger, and must always have at least two splits. All splits must always add up to zero.

column.name: TransactionNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: DateTimeEntry
column.summary: Not user editable. Server time.

column.name: UserNum
column.summary: FK to user.UserNum.

column.name: DepositNum
column.summary: FK to deposit.DepositNum. Will eventually be replaced by a source document table, and deposits will just be one of many types.

column.name: PayNum
column.summary: FK to payment.PayNum. Like DepositNum, it will eventually be replaced by a source document table, and payments will just be one of many types.

table.name: treatplan
table.summary: A treatment plan saved by a user. Does not include the default tp, which is just a list of procedurelog entries with a status of tp. A treatplan has many proctp's attached to it.

column.name: TreatPlanNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: PatNum
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

column.name: DateTP
column.summary: The date of the treatment plan

column.name: Heading
column.summary: The heading that shows at the top of the treatment plan. Usually 'Proposed Treatment Plan'

column.name: Note
column.summary: A note specific to this treatment plan that shows at the bottom.

column.name: Signature
column.summary: The encrypted and bound signature in base64 format. The signature is bound to the byte sequence of the original image.

column.name: SigIsTopaz
column.summary: True if the signature is in Topaz format rather than OD format.

column.name: ResponsParty
column.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. Can be 0. The patient responsible for approving the treatment. Public health field not visible to everyone else.

table.name: usergroup
table.summary: A group of users. Security permissions are determined by the usergroup of a user.

column.name: UserGroupNum
column.summary: Primary key.

table.name: userod
table.summary: (User OD since "user" is a reserved word) Users are a completely separate entity from Providers and Employees even though they can be linked. A usernumber can never be changed, ensuring a permanent way to record database entries and leave an audit trail. A user can be a provider, employee, or neither.

column.name: UserNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: Password
column.summary: The password hash, not the actual password. If no password has been entered, then this will be blank.

column.name: UserGroupNum
column.summary: FK to usergroup.UserGroupNum. Every user belongs to exactly one user group. The usergroup determines the permissions.

column.name: EmployeeNum
column.summary: FK to employee.EmployeeNum. Cannot be used if provnum is used. Used for timecards to block access by other users.

column.name: ClinicNum
column.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. If 0, then user has access to all clinics.

column.name: ProvNum
column.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum. Cannot be used if EmployeeNum is used.

column.name: IsHidden
column.summary: Set true to hide user from login list.

column.name: TaskListInBox
column.summary: FK to tasklist.TaskListNum. 0 if no inbox setup yet. It is assumed that the TaskList is in the main trunk, but this is not strictly enforced. User can't delete an attached TaskList, but they could move it.

column.name: AnesthProvType
column.summary: Defaults to 3 (regular user) unless specified. Helps populates the Anesthetist, Surgeon, Assistant and Circulator dropdowns properly on FormAnestheticRecord///

column.name: DefaultHidePopups
column.summary: If set to true, the hide popups button will start out pressed for this user.

column.name: PasswordIsStrong
column.summary: Gets set to true if strong passwords are turned on, and this user changes their password to a strong password. We don't store actual passwords, so this flag is the only way to tell.

table.name: userquery
table.summary: A list of query favorites that users can run.

column.name: QueryNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: Description
column.summary: Description.

column.name: FileName
column.summary: The name of the file to export to.

column.name: QueryText
column.summary: The text of the query.

table.name: zipcode
table.summary: Zipcodes are also known as postal codes. Zipcodes are always copied to patient records rather than linked. So items in this list can be freely altered or deleted without harming patient data.

column.name: ZipCodeNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: ZipCodeDigits
column.summary: The actual zipcode.

column.name: IsFrequent
column.summary: If true, then it will show in the dropdown list in the patient edit window.
